{"code":1,"isDone":false,"toInsertArticleList":[{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>We've all been there—you go on a few dates hoping to connect with someone, only to realize that it's not going to work out. Instead of wasting your time and theirs, it's best to end things when you realize this. Fortunately, since you've only been out with them a few times, you can let them down without really hurting their feelings. Check out our suggestions for kindly ending a short relationship. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Act on your feelings as soon as possible.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Act-on-your-feelings-as-soon-as-possible.\">Act on your feelings as soon as possible.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Don't wait or keep going on dates if you know it's not working out. The longer you wait to talk with the person, the harder it will be to break things off. You never know—the other person might feel the same way too! Sure, it can be awkward to have the break up conversation after only a few dates, but you'll be less emotionally invested.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-1.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might know after just 1 or 2 dates that the relationship isn't going to work out. For others, it might take 3 or 4 dates to decide. Either way, talk with the other person as soon as you realize you don't want to date them.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Tell them that you want to end the relationship.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tell-them-that-you-want-to-end-the-relationship.\">Tell them that you want to end the relationship.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Meet in person or call them on the phone to break the news. There's no need to make small talk or drag out the conversation. Just let them know that you're not interested in going on more dates. You don't need to go deep into how you feel or apologize—after all, you only went on a few dates.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-2.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, call them and say, \"Hi, so this is awkward for me, but I don't think I want to go out with you anymore. I just wanted to be honest with you and not lead you on.\"</li> \n    <li>You could say, \"I wanted to tell you that I enjoyed getting to know you a little, but I'm just not feeling a spark. I hope you find someone great to spend time with!\"<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Don't feel like you have to break up in person. It's one thing to end a long-term relationship on the phone, but you're probably not emotionally invested in each other after just a few dates, so a phone call is totally fine.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Break up by text if you don't want to call.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Break-up-by-text-if-you-don't-want-to-call.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Break-up-by-text-if-you-don.27t-want-to-call.\">Break up by text if you don't want to call.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Clearly tell them that you don't want to date again. Be honest and just let them know that it's not going to work out. Here are a few great ways to get your point across:<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-3.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Tbh it's been fun hanging out but I don't think we're meant to be a couple.</li> \n    <li>Hi! I really liked getting to know you, but I'm not feeling a connection. It was great to meet you though.</li> \n    <li>Hey, thanks for meeting me yesterday. I'm pretty sure you feel the same, but I didn't feel a romantic connection.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Be honest with them.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Be-honest-with-them.\">Be honest with them.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>You might feel bad so you start giving excuses, but don't! There's no need to apologize or tell them that you're not ready for a relationship. In fact, if you give vague reassurances, the person might think they have a chance for a relationship with you later on. It's better to be completely honest if you don't think there's a connection.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-4.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, instead of saying, \"I'm so sorry this isn't working out right now. I just came out of a serious relationship and I'm not ready for dating,\" say, \"Thanks for meeting up with me the last few days, but this relationship doesn't feel like a good fit. I just wanted to be honest with you.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Avoid apologizing.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Avoid-apologizing.\">Avoid apologizing.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>You haven't done anything wrong, so you don't need to say sorry. Some people might even misinterpret an apology—they may think that you still care for them. Remind yourself that you're being honest with yourself and them so there's no need to apologize.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-5.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Instead of saying, \"I'm so sorry, but this isn't working out,\" say, \"I don't feel like this is working out. I wish you the best of luck in your next relationship.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Listen if they have something to say.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Listen-if-they-have-something-to-say.\">Listen if they have something to say.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Give them a chance to respond so they feel respected. They may tell you they're surprised or they're disappointed, but don't feel like you have to defend yourself or your decision. Just let them respond to your decision.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-6.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might be surprised—maybe they'll say they were feeling the same way about the relationship.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Be clear about future interactions.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Be-clear-about-future-interactions.\">Be clear about future interactions.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Tell them if you want to be friends or if you're totally moving on. Once you say the relationship is over, give them an idea of your feelings. You might say that you'd like to be friends, especially if you have friends in common who you can hang out with, or you might say that you don't want to date or meet up with them again.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-7.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>To completely end things, you might say, \"It doesn't feel like we're compatible and I don't think this relationship will work out. I'd like to end things, but I wish you all the best in the future.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Don't ghost the person.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Don't-ghost-the-person.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Don.27t-ghost-the-person.\">Don't ghost the person.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Ignoring them can actually hurt them more than ending it. You might think that if you just ignore their calls or texts, they'll get the idea that you're not interested and they'll move on. Unfortunately, they may genuinely be hurt or confused by your lack of a response. They might even try harder to reach you, so it's best to be direct with them.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-8.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Ending the relationship is the best way to show the person that you respect them and their feelings. It also gives the other person some closure.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Relax and realize this is part of dating.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Relax-and-realize-this-is-part-of-dating.\">Relax and realize this is part of dating.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Not every relationship will be a long-term one and that's expected. Although breaking up with someone, even if it was just after a few dates, isn't fun, it's part of dating. Remind yourself this if you're feeling bad or guilty. Then, give yourself permission to move on.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Let Someone Down Easy After a Few Dates Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-9.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 14 Aug 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-1.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"c24cb4837f544a7e574d37675a092953","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-10-458_7b997a6d029412c9.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":68417,"destBytes":41818,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-1.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn15@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-10-458_7b997a6d029412c9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/33/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-2.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn53@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-927_1dd57a6f5bbed8cf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f7/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-3.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn58@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-283_d482cff6cee0b5b9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-4.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn49@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-31-758_11bcf384a6117ddf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5e/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-5.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn81@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-862_b681989dc676b6ea.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-6.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn5@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-31-535_82afb199a95df7de.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/78/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-7.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn49@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-29-560_68cedb5dbd23818b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-8.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn6@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-518_0455bbd4083e75f3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/83/Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-9.jpg/aid12657264-v4-728px-Let-Someone-Down-Easy-After-a-Few-Dates-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn49@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-32-064_057b5d199d564660.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590203},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Harvest Cilantro","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Cilantro is often used to add fresh flavor to Latin American and Southeast Asian dishes. If you're a fan, it's relatively easy to grow your own! As a bonus, once the plant dies and goes to seed, you can gather those seeds (called \"coriander seeds\") and grind them up as a spice.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> Here, we've gathered answers to some of your most common questions about how to grow and harvest this delicious herb. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: How do you know when cilantro is ready to pick?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-do-you-know-when-cilantro-is-ready-to-pick?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-do-you-know-when-cilantro-is-ready-to-pick.3F\">How do you know when cilantro is ready to pick?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Cilantro is ready when the plant is about tall. You can start to harvest cilantro leaves pretty early before the plant is full-grown. Leaves are typically ready between 45 and 70 days after seeding.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can pluck individual leaves even before then if you want without damaging the plant. Regular picking means more leaves, so pick as often as you like!<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: How do you pick cilantro?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-do-you-pick-cilantro?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-do-you-pick-cilantro.3F\">How do you pick cilantro?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pick leaves one by one or cut stems long. If you want to leave the plant to continue to grow, cut exterior leaves and use them as you need them. Your cilantro will continue to grow for at least a few weeks, producing more leaves.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're harvesting individual leaves, pick them from the top of the plant. That will keep the cilantro looking thick and full as it grows, rather than tall and lanky.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>To harvest the whole plant, cut with a small sickle-type knife just above the soil. Form a bunch of leaves and wrap a rubber band around the stems to secure the bunch together.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: How often should you harvest cilantro?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-often-should-you-harvest-cilantro?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-often-should-you-harvest-cilantro.3F\">How often should you harvest cilantro?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>You can harvest cilantro as often as possible until the plant bolts. The nice thing about cilantro is that once you pick the leaves, it'll immediately start growing new ones. As long as the plant hasn't started flowering, it'll just keep growing leaves and you can just keep picking them.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>While most cilantro plants only live a few months, this should still guarantee you at least 2 or 3 harvests from the same plant if you've timed your seeding right.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: How long will your cilantro stay fresh after picking?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-long-will-your-cilantro-stay-fresh-after-picking?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-long-will-your-cilantro-stay-fresh-after-picking.3F\">How long will your cilantro stay fresh after picking?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Your cilantro will stay fresh for as long as 14 days if you keep it cool. As soon as you pick your cilantro, immediately put it in a cooler or another container with ice or stick it in the fridge. Commercial cilantro is kept at temperatures between to maintain peak freshness.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Keep in mind that a little cilantro goes a long way. You probably don't need to plant several rows of cilantro in your garden to have enough cilantro to last you a while.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: What's the best way to store fresh-picked cilantro?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"What's-the-best-way-to-store-fresh-picked-cilantro?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"What.27s-the-best-way-to-store-fresh-picked-cilantro.3F\">What's the best way to store fresh-picked cilantro?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>For short-term storage, place cilantro in a plastic bag in the refrigerator. Cover it with a couple of layers of paper towels to help absorb moisture. This will keep your cilantro fresh for at least 3-5 days.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you need to keep your cilantro fresh for a week or longer, place the cilantro stem-down in a container of water, like you would a bouquet of flowers. Loosely cover the leaves with a plastic bag and put the whole thing in the fridge. Change the water every couple of days.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Should you let your cilantro flower?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Should-you-let-your-cilantro-flower?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Should-you-let-your-cilantro-flower.3F\">Should you let your cilantro flower?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>No, once cilantro flowers (bolts), you can no longer harvest the leaves. After your cilantro flowers, the leaves won't have the flavor you want anymore. On top of that, the plant will die (go to seed) within a few days after bolting. So if you want those tasty cilantro leaves, keep it from bolting for as long as possible. If you harvest by cutting the main stem about from the soil, you can postpone the process.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 6 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-6-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Planting cilantro in a cooler part of your garden with partial shade can help keep it from bolting early. If you've already planted your cilantro, make a shade to partially cover the plants during the day when the sun's the hottest.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>There are also some \"bolt-resistant\" cilantro varieties available. These will get you more cilantro from your plants, especially if you live in a warmer climate with hot summers.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Will the cilantro plant grow back after harvest?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Will-the-cilantro-plant-grow-back-after-harvest?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Will-the-cilantro-plant-grow-back-after-harvest.3F\">Will the cilantro plant grow back after harvest?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Yes, you can harvest leaves early and they'll continue to grow. Harvest leaves one by one or cut them only about a third of the way down the plant to ensure they'll keep growing. The plant will continue to produce leaves for a month or two before it dies.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Cilantro doesn't live for very long (only about 3 months at most), but you can usually get several good harvests out of one plant.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Do cilantro plants come back every year?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Do-cilantro-plants-come-back-every-year?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Do-cilantro-plants-come-back-every-year.3F\">Do cilantro plants come back every year?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Yes, if you leave it to flower and don't harvest the seeds. Cilantro is an annual plant, meaning it doesn't \"come back\" from the same seeds every year. But it does re-seed itself if you let it, which makes your job as a gardener a lot easier! Just wait for it to flower and let it drop the seeds to the ground. Leave those seeds alone and they'll grow into new plants for you next year.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Harvest-Cilantro-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Harvest Cilantro Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-8.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This only works if you have a dedicated bed for your cilantro (or if you're growing it indoors in a container). If you're growing your cilantro in a larger garden alongside other herbs and vegetables, it's probably better to seed it yourself each year.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Cilantro is a great companion to plant alongside dill, potatoes, or tomatoes.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>If it's coriander seeds you're after, wait until about 3 months after planting and remove the brown, fruiting part of the plant. Allow it to dry, then collect the seeds and store them in a dry, tightly sealed container.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Cilantro has a short life. If your plant dies after a couple of months, that doesn't mean you've done anything wrong! It simply isn't around as long as other leafy herbs, such as parsley.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Harvest-Cilantro&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Harvest-Cilantro#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://agrilifeextension.tamu.edu/library/gardening/cilantro/\">https://agrilifeextension.tamu.edu/library/gardening/cilantro/</a></span> </li> \n   <li
