\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 09 Aug 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"a6aa2d642c60a3ae70cfb790801c9451","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn50@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-22-565_0e6565c79519dd42.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":90955,"destBytes":55190,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1b/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn50@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-22-565_0e6565c79519dd42.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/90/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn17@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-30-129_9835a719c9d3b5e7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn6@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-31-232_437dc2fc8b8da6a0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fc/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn65@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-552_ed13e4db71bd22c2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn20@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-29-126_f785587cb8547a64.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/28/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn30@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-31-942_4c327da8b1b27ff5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e5/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn10@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-32-545_d6e8927c64e7d0e5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c7/Harvest-Cilantro-Step-8.jpg/aid12677725-v4-728px-Harvest-Cilantro-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn97@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-076_2d8c226af4f0f59a.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590216},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Convert Word to PowerPoint","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\"><p>If you plan to present a text-heavy PowerPoint presentation, it may be easier to type your content in Microsoft Word first. But how can you convert your Word document into PowerPoint slides without copying and pasting?  With a few formatting changes, you can actually save yourself the hassle of retyping everything and convert your Word documents right to PowerPoint.\n</p>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint&#38;action=edit&#38;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint&#38;action=edit&#38;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Formatting the Word Document\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Formatting-the-Word-Document\">Formatting the Word Document</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Open your document using Microsoft Word.  Double-click your Word document to open it for editing. Before you try to convert a Word document to a PowerPoint presentation, you'll have to adjust the formatting so it can translate PowerPoint slides.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Separate the Word document into sections with titles. For PowerPoint to properly import the Word document, you'll need to break the document into separate sections that will become individual slides. Each section needs a title at the top, and the title should be on its own line. The title will then become the title of that section's PowerPoint slide.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/35/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>For example, let's say the first page of your Word document contains sales information that you'd like to appear on a PowerPoint slide called \"Works Cited.\" At the top of that section, you'd type \"Words Cited\" as the title, since you want that to be the name of your slide. Below that would be the content of the slide.</li>\n<li>Press <b>Enter</b> or <b>Return</b> after each section so there's at least one empty line between the end of a section and the  title of the next slide.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Navigate to the \"Styles\" menu. Click the <b>Home</b> tab if you're not already there—you will then see a \"Styles\" panel in the toolbar at the top of Word. In it are several formatting examples labeled \"Normal,\" \"No Spacing,\" \"Heading 1,\" etc.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Highlight the title of your first slide/section. Just click and drag your mouse across the entire title to select it.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Click the  style. The text will become large, bolded, and colored blue. PowerPoint will know to use everything with the \"Header 1\" style as a new slide.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>You will need to do this for all slides in your document.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Highlight the remaining content of your first slide. Now you'll need to select the rest of the text you want to add to the first slide—don't include the title in the highlighted area—just the content of the slide.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Make sure you have at least one blank line between the title and the rest of the slide's content.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Click  on the Styles panel. Everything in the Heading 2 format will appear on the same slide as the title.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>In the content area, press the <b>Enter</b> or <b>Return</b> key to add space between every block of text you want separated on the slide. Every individual line or paragraph will be a different bullet on your final slide.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Add sub-bullets using  (optional). If you assign something to \"Heading 3,\" it will appear indented to the right and on a separate line. The PowerPoint slide would appear like the following:<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Text formatted with \"Heading 2\"\n<ul><li>Text formatted with \"Heading 3\"</li></ul></li></ul></li>\n<li>Separate each slide with a space. Press <b>Enter</b> or <b>Return</b> before each new title. This creates the outline for PowerPoint. Each large, bolded line indicates a title and the smaller text underneath is the content of that slide. If there is a space, then another title, PowerPoint will separate this into a new slide.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Customize your text if you'd like. Once you've set up the outline you can change the size, color, and font of your text, which will convert to PowerPoint. The text no longer needs to be blue or bolded -- it has already been coded for conversion to PowerPoint<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 10 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-10-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If you delete the spaces between lines or try to add new text, it may not be formatted correctly, so always do this step last.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Save the document. Once you're finished formatting your entire document, click the <b>File</b> menu, select <b>Save as</b>, click <b>Browse</b>, and choose a folder to save the file to. Give the file a name like \"Outline\" or something similar, and then click <b>Save</b>.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Close Word when you're finished so there are no conflicts with PowerPoint in the remaining steps.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint&#38;action=edit&#38;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Converting to PowerPoint\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Converting-to-PowerPoint\">Converting to PowerPoint</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Open PowerPoint. It'll be in your Windows Start menu on Windows, or in the Applications folder on macOS.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 12 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-12-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Click the  option. If you don't see it, click the <b>File</b> menu and then select <b>Open</b>.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 13 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-13-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Click . This opens your file browser.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Navigate to the folder in which you saved your Word document outline. Don't panic if you don't see the outline!<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 15 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-15-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Select  from the drop-down menu. This is the menu that says \"All PowerPoint Presentations\" by default. You should now see the Word document you saved earlier.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 16 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-16-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Select your Word document and click . PowerPoint will now create a presentation consisting of the slides you created in your Word document. Every title you set to \"Header 1\" appears on its own slide, along with its corresponding content, which you set to \"Header 2.\" You can now <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-a-Great-PowerPoint-Presentation\" title=\"Make a Great PowerPoint Presentation\">design the slides</a> however you'd like using all of your favorite PowerPoint tools.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 17 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-17-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>Word will not automatically convert images for you—you will have to manually <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Add-Images-to-a-PowerPoint-Presentation\" title=\"Add Images to a PowerPoint Presentation\">add the images</a> into your presentation.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Save the file as a PowerPoint presentation. To save your presentation, click <b>File</b>, select <b>Save as</b>, choose a saving location, and then save the file with the <b>.PPTX</b> extension.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-18-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Convert Word to PowerPoint Step 18 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-18-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li></ol>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint&#38;action=edit&#38;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2>\n<ul><li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Insert-a-File-Into-a-Word-Document\" title=\"Insert a File Into a Word Document\">Insert a File Into a Word Document</a></li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint&#38;action=edit&#38;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 13 Aug 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"2912822fe6aebf3dc09e20693c4312fe","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn34@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-11-561_f7184b77976b1e2e.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":29186,"destBytes":12708,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/68/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn34@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-11-561_f7184b77976b1e2e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/35/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn66@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-056_c873916db50c76c7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/48/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn26@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-928_f7c03d9db223df47.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e8/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn17@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-998_e4df9bc3295006b6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn38@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-30-625_5acff1cb86dd53b7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/26/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn33@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-31-604_f54bd6bb89328f71.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn21@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-31-523_3283d0eb9ae82705.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/44/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn79@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-29-383_c791dd3dbabd1630.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8b/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-9-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn25@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-30-475_8deabbd52df34bc1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b5/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-10-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-10-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn98@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-30-023_4f20a1388d1d4024.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ad/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn1@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-30-129_492c284470696fd9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e4/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx13/cdn81@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-29-639_e76a79ac39948604.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/73/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn2@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-32-415_5a7a05b8bd41884f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2f/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn54@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-29-570_5ae526eaa5effb1d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-15-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-15-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn31@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-29-082_d0bc1757948ccfe6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5a/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-16-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-16-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn37@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-025_50c9d56c73b4c8f1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d9/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-17-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-17-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn14@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-40-561_90b2c9c9fbe2074e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bf/Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-18-Version-2.jpg/aid1988041-v4-728px-Convert-Word-to-PowerPoint-Step-18-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn53@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-30-940_27935b4a8b3df831.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590247},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Prepare for Each School Day","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Being ready to take on each school day really boils down to a good routine. A lot of the stuff you need to do to get ready for school can be done the night before when you have more time. If you don't have a lot of time in the evening after school, prepare what you can on the weekend so it's ready to go for each day. Then, in the morning, all you need to concern yourself with is getting ready and heading out the door. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Prep for each week on the weekend.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Prep-for-each-week-on-the-weekend.\">Prep for each week on the weekend.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Use your weekends to set yourself up for success. On Sunday, get your clothes together for each day of the week and hang them in a special place in your closet so they're ready to go. If you take your lunch to school, you can also prep your lunches for the week and keep them in the fridge.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Go over your schedule for the week and take note of any special activities that might require a little extra prep work. Is there anything you can do in advance? Go ahead and get it ready so you don't have to worry about it during the week.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Time your morning routine.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Time-your-morning-routine.\">Time your morning routine.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>See how long it takes you to get ready for school. This will help you decide when you need to set your alarm so you aren't rushing in the morning. One weekend or another day you don't have school, go through the motions as though you are getting ready for school—check the time when you're done and you'll know how much time you need each morning.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, you might find that it takes you 30 minutes to do everything you need to do in the morning at a normal pace. Add 15 minutes to this time (just in case anything goes wrong) and set your alarm for 45 minutes before you need to leave.</li> \n    <li>Don't forget to add in time to wake up as well. If it usually takes a couple of minutes for the alarm to wake you up, set it a couple of minutes earlier than you need to get up to account for that.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Finish your homework as soon as possible.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Finish-your-homework-as-soon-as-possible.\">Finish your homework as soon as possible.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Attack your homework before you do anything else. If you do your homework first, you won't have it hanging over your head. Once it's done, you'll know you have the rest of the evening to do whatever you want to do before bed.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Getting your homework done first also means you know it's done so you won't have to stress about it in the morning.</li> \n    <li>Set up a particular spot to do your homework every day. When you get home, go directly to that spot and start working.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Share any school news with your parents.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Share-any-school-news-with-your-parents.\">Share any school news with your parents.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Handle permission slips or other school reports in the evening. If you have anything you brought home that your parents need to sign, show it to them around dinnertime. This gives them time to look over it and discuss it with you if they need to.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you need permission for a school event or outing, put it on your family calendar. Set reminders if you need to do anything specific to prepare.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Pack your bag according to your schedule.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Pack-your-bag-according-to-your-schedule.\">Pack your bag according to your schedule.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Include the books and supplies you'll need for the next school day. Check your schedule and put the books, supplies, and other materials you'll need for the next day in your bag. Take out anything you won't need and leave it at home.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you'll need a change of clothes for PE or another activity, make sure they're clean and ready to go along with your other school things.</li> \n    <li>You might want to check the weather as well. For example, if it's supposed to rain tomorrow, you'll want to make sure you have a raincoat or umbrella ready.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Prepare your lunch.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Prepare-your-lunch.\">Prepare your lunch.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If you take your lunch to school with you, pack it in the evening. This gives you less to worry about in the morning. You can always put it in the fridge for the next day to keep anything from spoiling.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're eating lunch at school, you might want to look at the lunch menu schedule so you know what your options are for the next day. If you have a choice, figure out what you want the night before so you won't have to make a decision on the spot tomorrow.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Take a bath or shower.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Take-a-bath-or-shower.\">Take a bath or shower.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>A warm bath or shower can help you relax and get ready for bed. You likely want to take a bath or shower at night anyway, especially if you were active during the day. Taking it 1-2 hours before you go to bed will help you get to sleep faster and have better quality sleep.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A bubble bath or shower gel with a calming scent, such as lavender, also helps relax you and improve your sleep quality.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Do something relaxing before bed.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Do-something-relaxing-before-bed.\">Do something relaxing before bed.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>A quiet activity, such as reading a book, helps your mind calm down for sleep. For an hour or so before you go to bed, turn down the lights and do something calm and relaxing. This will get your mind and body to slow down and get ready for sleep more naturally. This works best if everybody else in your family is also engaged in relatively quiet activities so they don't disturb or distract you.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the sun is still out when you're transitioning toward bedtime, close the blinds or curtains so the natural light won't come into your room.</li> \n    <li>Avoid stimulating activities, such as exercise or watching an exciting television show, right before bed. When you stimulate your mind, you'll have a harder time falling asleep and won't sleep as deeply when you finally do.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Get a good night's sleep.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Get-a-good-night's-sleep.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Get-a-good-night.27s-sleep.\">Get a good night's sleep.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Establish a bedtime routine and go to bed at the same time every night. Studies show that grade-school-age children need between 9 and 11 hours of sleep each night, while teenagers need 8 to 10 hours. Count backward from the time you need to wake up for school every morning to establish your bedtime.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-9.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you're 16 years old and you need to get up at 6 a.m., that means you need to go to bed sometime between 8 p.m. and 10 p.m. If 8 p.m. sounds way too early for you to go to bed, start with a 10 p.m. bedtime. You can always adjust it if you consistently feel tired in the morning.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Wake up with your alarm.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Wake-up-with-your-alarm.\">Wake up with your alarm.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Get up at the same time every morning. Even though you've done most of your prep work the night before, you still don't want to be rushing around in the morning. Leave yourself plenty of time to get cleaned up, get dressed, and get your things together before you have to leave.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-10.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you have to catch your bus at 7:30, you might want to wake up at 6:30. This gives you an hour to get dressed, eat breakfast, wash your face, brush your teeth, and make sure you have everything you'll need for school.</li> \n    <li>You might find that you don't need as much time in the morning, but be careful not to cut it too close. Ideally, you'll have time to do everything you need to do and still be calm, friendly, and social with your family before heading out.</li> \n    <li>Since you went to sleep at the appropriate hour, you should feel well-rested in the morning. If you feel tired, bump your bedtime up a half-hour and see if that helps. You might have to play around with it a little until you find the right time.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Eat a good breakfast before you leave.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Eat-a-good-breakfast-before-you-leave.\">Eat a good breakfast before you leave.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>A balanced breakfast typically includes protein, fruit, and a vegetable.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup> Scrambled eggs only take a few minutes to make—add spinach to get your vegetable in. If you don't have time in the morning, make them in advance. Put your eggs between 2 slices of bread, an English muffin, or a bagel, then wrap it up and put it in the fridge. All you have to do is heat it in the microwave for about 10 seconds and it'll be good to go.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-11.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Stay away from sugary cereals and toaster pastries—the sugar will cause you to crash later and won't give you the focused energy you need.</li> \n    <li>If your school serves breakfast, it's fine to wait until you get there to eat something. Just make sure you're starting your day with something healthy that will give you the energy you need.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Get dressed and ready.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Get-dressed-and-ready.\">Get dressed and ready.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Wash your face, brush your teeth, and comb your hair. Since you took a bath or shower last night, this should be all you need to do to look your best in the morning—and it probably won't take you more than 10 or 15 minutes. Start by putting on the clothes that you laid out last night. If you have longer hair, you might want to pull it back so it's out of your way at school or more manageable during activities.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-12.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Give yourself a little extra time if you wear makeup to school or if you have other accessories you want to put on.</li> \n    <li>Glance in the mirror one last time and smile—you're ready to go!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: Check your materials in your bag.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Check-your-materials-in-your-bag.\">Check your materials in your bag.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Double-check to make sure you have everything you need. This helps you remember anything that you might have forgotten the night before. Go over your schedule and make sure you have everything you need for each of your classes that day.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Prepare for Each School Day Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-13.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You might consider putting up a copy of your schedule next to the door so you can do a quick double-check right before you head out.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>A checklist with your evening and morning routines will help you remember everything until it all becomes habitual.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>If you're finding that it's taking you too long to wake up in the morning, try setting your alarm across your room. That way, you'll need to walk over to it in order to turn it off. Doing this may help you wake up.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Develop-a-Morning-Routine-(Teens)\" title=\"Develop a Morning Routine (Teens)\">Develop a Morning Routine (Teens)</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Organized-in-School\" title=\"Be Organized in School\">Be Organized in School</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Be-Mentally-Prepared-and-Organized-Before-School-Starts\" title=\"Be Mentally Prepared and Organized Before School Starts\">Be Mentally Prepared and Organized Before School Starts</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Prepare-for-Each-School-Day&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 10 Aug 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"c452039972655336363e852b8e512453","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn3@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-22-760_8fde977301d2ec95.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":51577,"destBytes":20254,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/25/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn3@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-22-760_8fde977301d2ec95.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn70@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-30-448_b7048f95c142116a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn41@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-522_e5de52bbc81f7a2a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn54@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-32-100_78471ebbedad9df5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2e/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-5-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn98@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-444_f3a5aed4097f40ab.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e0/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-6-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn11@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-29-629_bccb32ab69374058.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4e/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn87@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-28-953_fb8e56839222545b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn16@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-29-080_b8ce9f46ed640e6f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-9.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn10@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-29-701_3d6a7fe30c8d8d0e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-10.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn77@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-984_decb5230cbfad871.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5c/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-11.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn77@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-40-935_fd8c8e6282cb7fc9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-12.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn98@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-30-895_dc0dee2606cf5c0b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/49/Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-13.jpg/aid424514-v4-728px-Prepare-for-Each-School-Day-Step-13.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn17@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-30-578_c8480bb4a8efebfe.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590211},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>This wikiHow teaches you how to create and send Friendmojis on Snapchat using your Android phone or tablet. A Friendmoji is a special type of Bitmoji that features both you and a friend in one sticker. After you and your friend have both linked your Bitmoji avatars to Snapchat, it'll be easy to send cute Friendmojis to each other while chatting—you can even add them as stickers to your photo and video Snaps. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Linking your Bitmoji to Snapchat\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Linking-your-Bitmoji-to-Snapchat\">Linking your Bitmoji to Snapchat</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Create your Bitmoji. If you haven't already <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-Bitmoji\" title=\"Use Bitmoji\">created a Bitmoji</a> for yourself, you'll need one before you can use Friendmoji. To get started, download the Bitmoji app from the Play Store, open it up, and follow the on-screen instructions to create the new cartoon version of yourself!\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Open Snapchat on your Android. This is the yellow-and-white ghost icon in your app list. Snapchat will open up to the camera screen.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap the profile icon. It's at the top-left corner.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> This opens your profile.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap or . The option you see varies depending on whether you've ever linked a Bitmoji to Snapchat.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Tap the button. Consider reading the <b>Terms of Service</b> and <b>Privacy Policy</b> above the Agree &amp; Connect button before you connect Bitmoji to Snapchat. Once you agree, your Bitmoji will be linked to Snapchat.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Tap the back button to return to the camera screen.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Sending Friendmojis\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Sending-Friendmojis\">Sending Friendmojis</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Swipe right on the camera screen. This opens the Chat screen, where you'll find conversations with your friends.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Open a chat. You can tap any existing chat to open it, or tap the New Chat button (the speech bubble) at the top-right corner to create a new one.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can even send Friendmoji in group chats!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tap the sticker icon. It's the smiley face at the bottom of the chat. You'll now see various Friendmoji you can share that contain both you and your friend (as long as your friend has a Bitmoji).\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're in a group chat, you'll only see Friendmoji for one friend at first. To see options starring a different friend, tap and hold any Friendmoji to display all of your friends' avatars, and then tap the friend you want in your Friendmoji. This refreshes the list to display Friendmoji of you and that person. Finally, tap a Friendmoji to send it to the group chat.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tap the Friendmoji you want to send. This sends the Friendmoji to your friend(s) in the chat.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Get Friendmojis on Snapchat on Android Step 9 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-9-Version-3.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-9-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also add Friendmoji to your Snaps. After creating a photo or video Snap, tap the sticker (the square with a folded-up corner) on the Snap, tap the winking face at the top, and then tap the Friendmoji you want to add. You can then drag the Friendmoji anywhere on the Snap, and-or resize it by pinching (or reverse-pinching) it with two fingers.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 10 Aug 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"31dc412961a254f22a696a49383eb885","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn26@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-22-654_64264540f7802a8f.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":54210,"destBytes":29710,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn26@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-22-654_64264540f7802a8f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn22@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-31-947_78fa6c13a6cc9625.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3d/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn17@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-29-953_8c0150dba7941307.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-4-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn44@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-29-139_8417a04f065f155e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c4/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid8942222-v4-728px-Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn82@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-30-360_6d540c31abb37896.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c0/Get-Friendmojis-on-Snapchat-on-Android-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/
