</li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Mon, 09 Aug 2021 00:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"c0be469d99cce69be9d2a4bdc74c1562","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn37@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-10-542_a5f8ba45f9759101.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":31699,"destBytes":18110,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ac/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn37@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-10-542_a5f8ba45f9759101.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/46/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn57@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-30-980_964bd4bd600e5189.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/da/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn77@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-32-274_7755a12a15e7a8f5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f4/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn89@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-32-296_b44dbbfaebe70588.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/72/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn98@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-28-976_c2a745ae59c2a9b3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-6-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-6-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn90@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-30-705_83ff27ebc956462e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-7-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn82@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-30-105_59d1812fd4a4c36f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e7/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-8-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn82@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-792_799440b696010eaf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-9-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn45@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-077_5f9f07a57993ebe1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/67/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-10-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn86@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-32-348_2827e0a2ff390e2d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/1c/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-11-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn30@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-31-654_3862b89896003556.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-12-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-12-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn21@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-40-944_f2413ee62d974627.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-13-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-13-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn70@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-32-170_6a1301ebe76d06a4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c1/Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid12685726-v4-728px-Help-an-Angry-Toddler-Step-14-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn24@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-29-059_322e1a8bb135ab60.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590235},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Make Someone Smile with Words","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you're looking to make someone smile, there's not much better than some simple, kind words. They can really make someone's day and leave you both feeling happy. It can be hard to know exactly what to say, though. This article is here to help you find the right words. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Compliment them geniunely.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Compliment-them-geniunely.\">Compliment them geniunely.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>A little validation will make anyone smile! Point out something you really like about this person, like their sense of humor or their excellent fashion sense. Let them know what you find so special about these qualities and be specific. If you give them a compliment and mean it, they'll most likely find it hard to stop smiling.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-1.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Next time you see your friend, say something like, \"I love that dress! You've got the best style.\"</li> \n    <li>Maybe your friend is always doing nice things for you. Next time they offer you a ride or get you a coffee, say, \"You're the most generous person I know!\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Crack a few jokes to make them laugh.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Crack-a-few-jokes-to-make-them-laugh.\">Crack a few jokes to make them laugh.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Use your sense of humor to put a smile on their face. This can really come in handy if you know someone going through hard times. Send your friend a funny message out of the blue, or use your sense of humor to make a stressful situation more manageable. A good joke will put a smile on your friend's face even in the darkest of circumstances.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b9/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-2.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Let's say you and a friend just found out that you have a massive class project due tomorrow, and you're going to have to pull an all-nighter to get it done. Say something like, \"Who needs sleep anyway? Sleepover at my house!\"</li> \n    <li>Maybe your coworker forgot their apron and now they have to wear one that's 3 sizes too big. Say something like, \"I think you look really fashion-forward! Those tiny aprons are so last season anyway.\"</li> \n    <li>Get a read on your friend's sense of humor before doing things like teasing them or using sarcasm.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Give some words of encouragement.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Give-some-words-of-encouragement.\">Give some words of encouragement.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Show your support by building them back up when they're down. Sometimes that's really all people need to start smiling again. If your friend messes up, tell them that everyone makes mistakes and that you've got faith in them. Maybe your friend's struggling with their self-confidence. Remind them of all the ways that they rock. Your kind words will definitely make them smile.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-3.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Perhaps you've noticed that the barista at your local coffee shop has seemed pretty stressed out lately. When it's your turn to order a coffee, say, \"You always handle the breakfast rush so well! I don't know how you do it.\"</li> \n    <li>Even small words of encouragement make a difference. Next time your friend says that they've got to study for an upcoming quiz, tell them that they're sure to ace it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Express your gratitude.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Express-your-gratitude.\">Express your gratitude.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Let this person know how happy they make you. Whether they're your best friend or an acquaintance that always makes you laugh, tell them how thankful you are to know them. Hearing that their words or actions made a positive impact on you can really brighten their outlook and make them smile.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-4.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Next time a coworker makes you cackle during a boring shift, say something like, \"I don't know what I'd do without you during these slow days. Thanks for always making me laugh!\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Offer words of support.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Offer-words-of-support.\">Offer words of support.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Telling someone that you're there for them can make them smile. You don't even have to be super good friends. Maybe you notice someone struggling to carry all of their groceries to their car. You can say something like, \"Let me know if I can help you with that!\" Even if they don't take you up on it, your kind offer will probably really make them smile.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-5.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Let's say that your friend just told you she has no idea how to style her hair for prom. Say something like, \"I can help you if you want to look up hairstyles together sometime! I'll bring over some magazines.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Share that you thought about them recently.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Share-that-you-thought-about-them-recently.\">Share that you thought about them recently.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>People like knowing that they're on your mind. Are you ever going about your day and find something that really reminds you of an old friend? Next time that happens, tell them! It will warm their heart to know that someone was thinking about them and will definitely make them smile.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-6.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Maybe you started cracking up thinking about a hilarious story your friend shared a few months ago. Text them, \"I still can't stop laughing about that story you told when we were camping. Thinking of you!\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Ask them if they need anything.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ask-them-if-they-need-anything.\">Ask them if they need anything.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Even if they don't, the fact that you thought to ask means a lot. Knock on your roommate's door or send a text to your friend before you head to the grocery store. Tell them that you would be happy to pick up some groceries for them or even just grab their favorite candy bar from the checkout aisle. An offer like this shows you care and can really brighten someone's day.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-7.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can even offer to cook a meal for them if they need a pick me up. Your offer alone will make them smile!<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Say that you miss them if they live far away.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Say-that-you-miss-them-if-they-live-far-away.\">Say that you miss them if they live far away.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>This is also a good thing to say if you haven't seen them in a while. Maybe your friend just moved to a new city or they started a job that makes it hard for them to make plans. Reach out and tell them that you miss them. For all you know, they could be really stressed out at their new job or a little lonely living in a new place. Telling them that they're missed will surely bring a smile to their face.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-8.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Text your friend something like, \"It's been way too long since we've gotten to hang out! Missing you.\"</li> \n    <li>You can even try calling your friend. Say something like, \"I needed to hear your voice. I feel like it's been forever since we've talked! I miss you.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Send them a friendly text.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Send-them-a-friendly-text.\">Send them a friendly text.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If you can't say your words face to face, message them instead! An encouraging or complimentary text out of nowhere can really make someone's day. If someone is on your mind and you want to make them smile, go ahead and send a text. It doesn't matter if they live thousands of miles away or they're your next-door neighbor. Reaching out like this is sure to make them happy.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-9.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Text them, \"I've been thinking about how much fun it was to hang out last month. I hope you're doing well!\"</li> \n    <li>If you haven't seen the person in a long time and want to make them smile, message them, \"Hey, I hope life has been treating you well! Miss you.\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Surprise them with a nice note.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Surprise-them-with-a-nice-note.\">Surprise them with a nice note.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>An act of kindness like this will make anyone smile. It shows you took the time to think about them, and it's a classic way to make someone smile. Write a message to your friend on a piece of paper or even a sticky note. Stick it on their desk next time you see them in class, or send them a postcard with a nice message if they live out of state.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-10.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Draft your letter on some scratch paper before writing the real thing. This can help you think of the right words to say.</li> \n    <li>You don't have to make it too long! Even just 3-5 sentences will be plenty to make someone feel special.</li> \n    <li>Write something like, \"Hey buddy! Just wanted to say that I'm so happy you're my friend. I hope you're having a great day. Can't wait to hang out soon!\"</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Validate their perspective.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Validate-their-perspective.\">Validate their perspective.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>This can do wonders for someone's happiness. If your friend shares how they're feeling with you, empathize with their point of view and affirm how they're feeling. Use phrases like, \"I completely understand\" or \"That makes total sense\" to communicate your validation. This may seem small, but it can really help someone work through their feelings and leave them smiling in no time.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-11.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Maybe your friend is going through a difficult breakup. If they vent to you, let them know that they have every right to feel that way!</li> \n    <li>If your friend confides in you about a bad day, say something like, \"Man, that does sound like a rough day. I'm sorry you had to go through that!\"</li> \n    <li>Follow your validation with some encouraging words to really bring a smile to their face.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Tell them a funny story.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tell-them-a-funny-story.\">Tell them a funny story.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Maybe your friend is going through something and needs a distraction. Make them happy by telling them a funny or positive story. It could even be something that relates to their situation. Relating to them with a story can help you empathize with their experience and really put a smile on their face.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Make Someone Smile with Words Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-12.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Let's say they had a bad day at work because they broke a tray of wine glasses. Tell them the story about the time you dropped an entire bulk container of maraschino cherries when you were a bartender!</li> \n    <li>Make sure you don't overpower the conversation. Don't sit down and tell them a grand, 20-minute tale. Keep things light and brief so they can still share their experience, too.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap\">\n  <ol class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/30/smarter-living/coronavirus-long-distance-relationships.html\">https://www.nytimes.com/2020/04/30/smarter-living/coronavirus-long-distance-relationships.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_ref-8\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://youtu.be/IW5L3Ta-si8?t=60\">https://youtu.be/IW5L3Ta-si8?t=60</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.teenvogue.com/gallery/48-ways-to-cheer-someone-up\">https://www.teenvogue.com/gallery/48-ways-to-cheer-someone-up</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/changepower/201410/9-ways-be-there-friend-without-giving-advice\">https://www.psychologytoday.com/us/blog/changepower/201410/9-ways-be-there-friend-without-giving-advice</a></span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sat, 07 Aug 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-1.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"a7f659fb7bec2147861bba922e788454","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn20@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-10-466_e2eed84f45e923d5.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":32823,"destBytes":19380,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-1.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn20@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-10-466_e2eed84f45e923d5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b9/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-2.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn70@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-30-961_00c0d96dc4be98cd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2c/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-3.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx33/cdn66@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-30-607_2c33039169072f2d.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-4.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn97@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-29-799_64bdd8efe3c4543b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/99/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-5.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn21@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-32-550_5c1f4b125f5c1421.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-6.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn5@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-30-149_381acf6208b2ced2.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3b/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-7.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn25@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-29-076_c844a283bc29f9a6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-8.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn60@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-29-213_0b9d6de29e0f9efb.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/42/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-9.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn42@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-652_7118824cf2e9706e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cc/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-10.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn10@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-222_18f8dba9766085cd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-11.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn50@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-30-943_59584cc67933c803.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-12.jpg/aid12640408-v4-728px-Make-Someone-Smile-with-Words-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn4@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-41-172_a82605c8efb4ee9f.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590221},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Wash Dishes","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Dishes can pile up quickly in your kitchen, but they're actually pretty easy to clean. Most dishes can be easily washed either by hand in the sink or by using a dishwasher, except for cast iron cookware. With a little time and effort, you'll soon have a stack of sparkly dishes! </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Cleaning Dishes by Hand\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cleaning-Dishes-by-Hand\">Cleaning Dishes by Hand</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Scrape any leftover food into the trash or garbage disposal. Use your silverware to push any leftover food on your dishes into the trash can. This quickly clears your plate and makes washing it easier later on. If you have a garbage disposal, you can put any uneaten food down the drain while your disposal is running.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wash-Dishes-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wash Dishes Step 1 Version 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Wash-Dishes-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-1-Version-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t pour any grease down your drain since it could solidify and clog your pipes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill your sink halfway with hot water and add of dish soap. Use the hottest water that you can handle putting your hands in! While the sink is filling up, pour of dish soap into the running water to create suds.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wash-Dishes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wash Dishes Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Wash-Dishes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure your sink is clean before washing your dishes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Work from lightly to heavily soiled dishes. Start by cleaning dishes such as utensils and drinking glasses. Then, move on to your plates and bowls. Lastly, soak and clean any pots, pans, or other cookware⁠⁠—leaving these for last is more effective since soaking loosens any stuck-on bits of food.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wash-Dishes-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wash Dishes Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Wash-Dishes-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Scrub your dishes underwater with a sponge or dishcloth. Keep the dishes underwater as you wash them to loosen any stuck-on food. Using circular motions, wipe each dish clean with a sponge or a dishcloth. If any leftover food is still stuck afterward, scrub it off and wash any other spots you missed as well.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the water gets too dirty to see through, drain your sink and refill it.</li> \n    <li>Be careful when handling knives! To clean knives safely, wipe them clean from the back so you aren’t holding onto the blade. You should also never keep sharp knives in the sink since they may be hard to see if the water gets dirty.</li> \n    <li>If your dishes have burnt-on food, soak them in your sink for 10-15 minutes before washing them.</li> \n    <li>For stubborn stains on ceramic dishes, mix baking soda and vinegar to create a paste, then scrub the paste into the stains with a cloth. Rinse off the paste with warm water.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>To clean a baking sheet with stuck-on food, mix baking soda and water to form a paste and scrub it into the food with a sponge. Add hydrogen peroxide to the mix for really stubborn stains.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Rinse off the soap with hot water. After you wash a dish, rinse it underneath the hottest water you can handle until the suds are gone. Make sure to rinse the inside of bowls and glasses a couple of times to ensure that all the suds are gone.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Avoid using cold water since it may cause water spots on your dishes.</li> \n    <li>If you have a double sink, you can rinse off the suds on the second side to be more efficient. Otherwise, just alternate between washing and rinsing.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Let the dishes dry on a rack or a clean towel. You can also dry them in the second side of a double sink. If you don’t have a drying rack, set the dishes upside down on a clean towel on your counter. Leave them to dry for 30-60 minutes.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It's safer and best to let your dishes air dry, since drying them with a dirty towel will only spread germs around more.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Rinse off your sink after you put your dishes away. You don’t want any grease or food bits floating around the next time you need to use your sink. Run hot water and use a sponge or microfiber cloth with dish soap to wipe your sink down⁠. Scrub longer if there are any areas with food stuck on. Work from the outside in, top to bottom⁠, so that dirty water doesn’t drip into areas you’ve already cleaned.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wash-Dishes-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wash Dishes Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Wash-Dishes-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Optionally, sprinkle some baking soda around the sink to break up any food particles before you begin.</li> \n    <li>If your sink is really dirty, plug it and then fill it up with water. Add a capful of bleach and let it sit for 5 minutes before draining and wiping the sink down.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Make sure your sink is clear of any items before you begin cleaning it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Loading a Dishwasher\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Loading-a-Dishwasher\">Loading a Dishwasher</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Get rid of any leftover food on your dishes and rinse them off. Scrape the food off of your plates or cookware into the garbage with your silverware to easily clear away the majority of it. Try to remove as much as you can so that it doesn’t clog your dishwasher. After you scrape the food from the dishes, rinse them in the sink to remove any smaller pieces that still may be stuck.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wash-Dishes-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wash Dishes Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Wash-Dishes-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re running your dishwasher immediately after you eat, you don’t need to rinse your dishes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put cups, small bowls, and plastics on the top shelf of your dishwasher. Set the cups and bowls between the tines on the top rack of your dishwashers⁠, and make sure they’re facedown or angled so that water doesn’t pool on them. Load from back to front so that you can fit more in.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Avoid nesting items, since this will prevent water from reaching and cleaning them.</li> \n    <li>Plastics are loaded on the top shelf to prevent them from melting because the bottom of the dishwasher is hotter.</li> \n    <li>Make sure all of your dishes say that they’re dishwasher-safe.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Load plates, serving bowls, and other larger cookware on the bottom rack. Keep large flat pans and any other oversized items on the sides or the back of the bottom rack so that they don’t block the water spray. Stand your plates on their ends so that their dirty sides face the water sprayer and are cleaned more effectively. When you put in your pots and pans, make sure they’re upside down so that water doesn’t pool inside them.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Most dishwashers have angled tines on the bottom rack so that your plates will point in the right direction.</li> \n    <li>Never stack your dishes on top of one another even if this seems more efficient, since the water in your dishwasher won’t be able to clean them all.</li> \n    <li>Do not load cookware made of wood, pewter, cast iron, crystal, fine china, bronze, or brass.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put the utensils into the basket on the bottom rack or door. Make sure the handles face downwards so the dirty parts get cleaned. Leave space in between each utensil so the water can get in between the surfaces.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Mix spoons, forks, and knives so that they don’t nest together. Don't load sharp knives because the dishwasher can dull them, but duller knives like butter knives are okay to put in the dishwasher.</li> \n    <li>Make sure long-handled utensils aren’t bumping into the water sprayer in the middle of your dishwasher. If they are, lay the utensils flat on the top rack instead.</li> \n    <li>Separate silver and stainless steel cutlery since the silver may pit when they’re touching.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fill the designated compartment with a detergent made for use in a dishwasher. Check the instructions on your dishwasher to see how much to add, but usually of detergent will work. Alternatively, you can use detergent powder or <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-Dishwasher-Pods\" title=\"Use Dishwasher Pods\">cleaning pods</a> inside your dishwasher.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wash-Dishes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wash Dishes Step 12 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Wash-Dishes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t use liquid dish soap, as this will leave a foamy residue on your dishes.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Run the dishwasher. Close the dishwasher door, select the cycle you want to run, and press start. Let the dishwasher run until it’s completed.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Wash-Dishes-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Wash Dishes Step 13 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Wash-Dishes-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The normal cycle on your machine will work fine for a regular wash.</li> \n    <li>Use the delicate cycle if your dishes are lightly soiled or if you have fragile glassware in your dishwasher.</li> \n    <li>Pick a heavy-duty cycle if you’re cleaning pots and pans.</li> \n    <li>When unloading, empty the bottom rack first so that water from the top rack doesn’t spill down.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Washing a Cast Iron Skillet\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Washing-a-Cast-Iron-Skillet\">Washing a Cast Iron Skillet</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pour hot water into the skillet immediately after you’re done using it. Right after you remove the food from the cast iron skillet, fill the pan half-full with the hottest water you can handle. This will make it easier to scrape off food later. Leave the pan on the stovetop instead of putting it in the sink.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Pour the water into the skillet using a cup so you don’t have to carry it to your sink.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Scrub off excess food with a new sponge or stiff-bristled brush. Hold onto the pan with an oven mitt or potholder using your non-dominant hand. Use your dominant hand to scrub any of the food that’s leftover from cooking immediately. Once the pan is clean, drain the water into your sink.<sup id=\"_ref-21\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 21\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-21\">[21]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t use detergent or steel wool on your pan since these can strip the pan.</li> \n    <li>If the water is too hot, use a long-handled brush or hold the sponge with tongs.</li> \n    <li>Don’t let the pan soak, or it could rust.</li> \n    <li>If there’s still leftover food after draining, sprinkle in 2 tablespoons (18 grams) of coarse kosher salt and scrub away the remaining bits. The salt acts as an abrasive that helps remove the stuck food.<sup id=\"_ref-22\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 22\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-22\">[22]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Dry the skillet on the stovetop. Leave your pan on the stove over low heat for 10-15 minutes, then remove it from the heat. Make sure to dry the entire pan so there’s no standing water or moisture left, or else your skillet could start to rust.<sup id=\"_ref-23\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 23\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-23\">[23]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Rub vegetable oil into the skillet with a paper towel. Oiling your cast iron skillet helps keep it in good condition. Pour of vegetable oil into the skillet and rub the cooking surface with a paper towel to coat it. Work in small circles to buff the oil into the iron. Leave the oil to dry for 20-30 minutes before putting the skillet away.<sup id=\"_ref-24\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 24\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Wash-Dishes#_note-24\">[24]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don't have any vegetable oil, you can substitute of melted shortening instead.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Do the dishes right away, when they’re dirty, rather than letting them pile up. It’ll be easier to get the food off this way too.</li> \n  <li>Make the task more enjoyable by listening to your favorite music or an audiobook while you wash!</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Never leave sharp knives in the sink or else you may cut yourself.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Cleaning Dishes by Hand\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cleaning-Dishes-by-Hand_2\">Cleaning Dishes by Hand</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Dish detergent</li> \n  <li>Sponge or dishcloth</li> \n  <li>Towel</li> \n  <li>Drying rack</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Loading a Dishwasher\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Loading-a-Dishwasher_2\">Loading a Dishwasher</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Dish detergent</li>\n </ul> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Washing a Cast Iron Skillet\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Washing-a-Cast-Iron-Skillet_2\">Washing a Cast Iron Skillet</span></h3> \n <ul>\n  <li>Sponge or stiff-bristled brush</li> \n  <li>Towel</li> \n  <li>Oven mitt or potholder</li> \n  <li>Paper towel</li> \n  <li>Coarse kosher salt</li> \n  <li>Vegetable oil</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Wash-Dishes&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Sun, 08 Aug 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Wash-Dishes-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-1-Version-4.jpg","linkMd5":"3579fca1135433cb50e8b5cf292e50e9","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn54@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-22-556_6797c502ceacbcc7.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":52740,"destBytes":33146,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/11/Wash-Dishes-Step-1-Version-4.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-1-Version-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn54@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-22-556_6797c502ceacbcc7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/30/Wash-Dishes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-2-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn34@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-30-681_2115a9d515fa0e92.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d2/Wash-Dishes-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-3-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn50@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-30-370_ec4f11a836e1d359.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Wash-Dishes-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn42@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-40-163_02c23bfed52d5bd0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/79/Wash-Dishes-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn82@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-32-356_785a148fa8c55fcd.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/ec/Wash-Dishes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-12-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn94@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-31-559_f2a50518f7bf8456.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/32/Wash-Dishes-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid3090-v4-728px-Wash-Dishes-Step-13-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn49@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-40-580_b693574a80662112.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590251},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Treat a Fire Ant Sting","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Fire ant stings can be painful and irritating, but most people don’t need medical treatment for them. Fortunately, there are things you can do to reduce the pain and itching and help your sting heal as fast as possible. However, in rare cases, it’s possible to be allergic to fire ant stings. We’ve put together answers to some of the questions you may have about getting stung by a fire ant. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: What do you put on fire ant bites?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"What-do-you-put-on-fire-ant-bites?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"What-do-you-put-on-fire-ant-bites.3F\">What do you put on fire ant bites?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Apply a cold compress for 20 minutes on, 20 minutes off. A <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Apply-a-Cold-Compress\" title=\"Apply a Cold Compress\">cold compress</a> can help reduce the swelling. Hold the cold compress against the affected area for 20 minutes, then remove it and let the area rest for 20 minutes. Repeat the process until your skin feels better and is less swollen.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/60/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make a cold compress by filling a plastic bag with ice cubes. Soak a washcloth under cool running water, then wrap it around the bag of ice. Press the cloth directly against your skin.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Use a hydrocortisone cream to relieve the itching. Buy hydrocortisone cream over the counter at any pharmacy or drugstore. Rub a little bit onto your skin wherever you were bitten to reduce the itchiness and irritation while it heals.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 2 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9a/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-2-Version-3.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-2-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can also use calamine lotion to treat the itchiness.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Try rubbing the sting with a paste made from water and baking soda. This is a home remedy that may work to reduce itching, swelling, and redness. Mix equal parts baking soda and water to form a paste. Apply the paste to your bites several times a day until your symptoms get better.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 3 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e1/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-3-Version-3.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-3-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: What medicine can I take for fire ant bites?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"What-medicine-can-I-take-for-fire-ant-bites?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"What-medicine-can-I-take-for-fire-ant-bites.3F\">What medicine can I take for fire ant bites?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Take an oral antihistamine to help relieve the itching. Any antihistamine used to treat allergies may reduce the itchiness. Take 1 pill every 8 to 12 hours as needed.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 4 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d7/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-4-Version-3.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-4-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: How long do fire ant bites last?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-long-do-fire-ant-bites-last?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-long-do-fire-ant-bites-last.3F\">How long do fire ant bites last?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>The initial pain and burning subside after 10 minutes or so. When a fire ant stings you, it feels a bit like a less-painful bee sting. The painful sensation goes away on its own and after that your skin starts to feel itchy. This itchiness can last for weeks after the sting.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 5 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c5/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-5-Version-3.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-5-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>It’s normal for the swelling in the bitten area to continue increasing for the first 24 hours.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>A pimple-like pustule forms within 24 hours and disappears after 3 days. For most people, the pustules dry up completely after a few weeks. After they dry up, they may leave a brown scar that can last for several months or longer.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 6 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-6-Version-3.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-6-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t worry if the sting turns red after the pustule forms. This is normal and doesn’t mean it’s infected.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Should I pop a fire ant bite?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Should-I-pop-a-fire-ant-bite?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Should-I-pop-a-fire-ant-bite.3F\">Should I pop a fire ant bite?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>No, don't pop the pustule that forms in the middle of the sting. If you pop the blister, you run the risk of it getting infected. Avoid scratching the bite, as well, as this can cause it to break and expose it to potential infection.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 7 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0e/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-7-Version-2.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-7-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the blister does break, cleanse the area with soapy water and monitor it for signs of infection. You can also apply an antibiotic ointment to any open stings. These ointments are available over-the-counter from most drug stores and pharmacies.</li> \n    <li>If the area becomes discolored or starts leaking pus, it may be infected. Seek medical attention immediately.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Why do fire ant bites hurt so much?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Why-do-fire-ant-bites-hurt-so-much?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Why-do-fire-ant-bites-hurt-so-much.3F\">Why do fire ant bites hurt so much?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Because the fire ants inject venom into your skin. Fire ants use their mandibles to clamp onto your skin, then sting you and inject the venom. This is what causes the initial burning sensation and the swelling that happens afterwards.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 8 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7e/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-8-Version-2.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-8-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Fire ant bites are generally more painful and larger in the summer, which is when fire ants have the most venom.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Can you be allergic to fire ant bites?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Can-you-be-allergic-to-fire-ant-bites?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Can-you-be-allergic-to-fire-ant-bites.3F\">Can you be allergic to fire ant bites?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It’s very rare, but it’s possible. Symptoms of a fire ant sting allergy include hives, itching and swelling in areas other than the place where you were bitten, nausea, vomiting, or diarrhea, tightness in the chest and difficulty breathing, and swelling of the throat, tongue, and lips, or difficulty swallowing. If you experience any of these symptoms after being stung, get to an emergency care center or hospital immediately.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 9 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/9b/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-9-Version-2.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-9-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Symptoms of an allergic reaction usually occur within 30 to 40 minutes of being stung.</li> \n    <li>In the most severe cases, people with an allergy may experience Anaphylactic shock, which can lead to dizziness, blackout, and cardiac arrest if not treated right away.</li> \n    <li>If you know yourself to be allergic to fire ant stings (or bee stings), you might already be carrying an epinephrine shot, commonly called an <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-an-Epipen\" title=\"Use an Epipen\">epi-pen (epinephrine)</a>. Inject yourself or have a friend help you, then proceed to the hospital.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: How do you keep fire ants from biting you?\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"How-do-you-keep-fire-ants-from-biting-you?\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"How-do-you-keep-fire-ants-from-biting-you.3F\">How do you keep fire ants from biting you?</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Move out of the area if you find fire ants on your body. Most stings occur when people accidentally step into or sit on a fire ant mound, disturbing hundreds of thousands of fire ants primed to defend their home. If you start seeing any fire ants on your body, the first thing to do is get up and leave the area as quickly as possible.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 10 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3c/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-10-Version-2.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-10-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you feel a fire ant bite you, leave the area immediately to prevent further ants crawling on you and getting more bites.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remove any ants from your skin. Fire ants clamp onto the body with their mandibles before they actually sting you. Quickly rub them off with your hand or a rag to remove them before they bite.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Treat a Fire Ant Sting Step 11 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/62/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-11-Version-2.jpg/aid96555-v4-728px-Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting-Step-11-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Jumping into water or running the ants under a spigot will not remove them if they have already clamped down with their mandibles.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>If there's a chance more ants have gotten into your clothes, remove your clothes immediately.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Prevent-Fire-Ant-Stings\" title=\"Prevent Fire Ant Stings\">Prevent Fire Ant Stings</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Treat-a-Stingray-Sting\" title=\"Treat a Stingray Sting\">Treat a Stingray Sting</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Treat-a-Fire-Ant-Sting&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section:
