021/08/15/03-53-43-155_a032ae51d93d542c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f3/Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-16.jpg/aid11960-v4-728px-Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-16.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn74@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-726_485a02e3ed4f21f4.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d0/Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-17.jpg/aid11960-v4-728px-Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-17.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn73@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-582_1ea05c76391c7c20.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/24/Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-18.jpg/aid11960-v4-728px-Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-18.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn62@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-523_40e5936d241775ed.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/ce/Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-19.jpg/aid11960-v4-728px-Extend-Speaker-Wires-Step-19.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn46@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-30-005_39ab36f1bdbd2628.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590246},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Have Good Table Manners","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Whether you’ve been invited to a dinner party or you’re going out to eat, brushing up on your table manners is a good way to prepare. Having table manners can leave a great impression on your fellow guests, and it will help everyone feel happy and comfortable as they enjoy their meal. We’ve compiled a list of things to remember at the dinner table so you can enjoy delicious food and fun times with your friends and family members. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Wash your hands before you sit down.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Wash-your-hands-before-you-sit-down.\">Wash your hands before you sit down.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Make sure your hands are clean before you dig in. Head to the restroom and give your hands a good scrubbing with soap and water before you sit down. If you’re teaching table manners to a kid, this is a good time to tell them how long to wash their hands and how hard to scrub.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-1.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Some fancier restaurants will even bring you a dish of water to dip your hands in. However, this is usually reserved for fine dining.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Put your phone on silent.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Put-your-phone-on-silent.\">Put your phone on silent.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>No one wants to be interrupted by a ringing phone. Before you head to the table, put your phone on silent or vibrate and stash it away in a pocket or a purse. If you get an important phone call, excuse yourself from the table to take it so you don’t disturb any other guests.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/12/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-2.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to keep your phone off the table while you eat. It can be a distraction to keep it so close to the food.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Wait for everyone to be seated.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Wait-for-everyone-to-be-seated.\">Wait for everyone to be seated.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>This includes the host, too! If you’re at a dinner party, let everyone get settled before you touch your place setting. The same goes for a restaurant—once your party is seated, you can start getting settled.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5d/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-3.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If there isn’t assigned seating, give the guest of honor or the host the best seat at the table (usually the seat at the head of the table). Everyone else can sit wherever they’d like to.</li> \n    <li>Always enter and leave the dining chair from it’s right in a restaurant and at a formal dinner. Before doing so help the lady on your right or left by pulling her chair back when she starts sitting and the pushing it in. Men in military enter the chair from left and leave from right as formal dinner is considered a parade.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Place your napkin on your lap.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Place-your-napkin-on-your-lap.\">Place your napkin on your lap.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It will catch any food that falls off your fork. Unfold your napkin and gently place it over your entire lap, smoothing it down so it lays flat. You can use your napkin throughout your meal to wipe your hands or your mouth as you need to.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/ae/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-4.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The napkin is the very first thing you want to touch when sitting down.</li> \n    <li>If you need to leave the table, put your napkin on the chair, not on the table. It will signal that you’re coming back and you aren’t finished with your food.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Pass all food dishes to the right.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Pass-all-food-dishes-to-the-right.\">Pass all food dishes to the right.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If you’re serving your own food, keep passing dishes around. Once you’ve taken enough food, hand the dish off to the person on your right. Try not to reach over anyone to get more food, and politely ask them to pass you a dish if you’d like more.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If there’s bread on the table, cut some off the loaf and offer the pieces to the person on your left before passing it on.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Don’t eat until the host eats.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Don’t-eat-until-the-host-eats.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Don.E2.80.99t-eat-until-the-host-eats.\">Don’t eat until the host eats.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If there’s no host, wait for the guest of honor to start eating. Once they take their first bite, you can go ahead and dig in! Some people also like to say grace or make a toast before a meal, so you may have to wait on that, too.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/01/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-6.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re having food with your family, wait until the person who made the food starts eating.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Use the utensils from the outside in.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Use-the-utensils-from-the-outside-in.\">Use the utensils from the outside in.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Fine dining may have more than one set of utensils. If you aren’t sure which one to use, a good rule of thumb is just to work from the outside in. As you eat through different courses, you’ll use different spoons or forks.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-7.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you’re just at a dinner party with friends and family, you probably won’t have to worry about multiple sets of utensils.</li> \n    <li>On your left, the utensils from the outside in are the salad fork, the dinner fork, and the dessert fork. On your right, you'll have a soup spoon, then a tea spoon, then a dinner knife.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Keep your elbows off the table.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Keep-your-elbows-off-the-table.\">Keep your elbows off the table.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Tuck them in by your sides while you eat. Putting your elbows on the table takes up a lot of space, and it’s considered bad manners. If you have any older relatives at the table, they might even call you out on it!<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a9/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-8.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you aren’t eating or you’re in between courses, it’s okay to rest your elbows on the table. The no elbows rule only applies when utensils are in use.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Eat slowly and with your mouth closed.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Eat-slowly-and-with-your-mouth-closed.\">Eat slowly and with your mouth closed.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Try not to show anyone your food as you chew. If you want to say something, finish what’s in your mouth and swallow before speaking up. Eat your food slowly and one bite at a time to avoid wolfing anything down.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/bc/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-9.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The same goes for drinking: try to take small sips and avoid slurping or splashing your drink.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Say “please” and “thank you.”\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Say-“please”-and-“thank-you.”\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Say-.E2.80.9Cplease.E2.80.9D-and-.E2.80.9Cthank-you..E2.80.9D\">Say “please” and “thank you.”</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>This includes thanking the host at the end of the meal. Make sure you’re polite and respectful to everyone around you when you ask them to pass you food or hand you more bread. If you’re being served your food at a restaurant, say thank you to the servers as they bring you items.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/74/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-10.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Take part in the conversation.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Take-part-in-the-conversation.\">Take part in the conversation.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>A dinner party is about more than just food. As you eat, be sure to talk to the other guests around you and join in on the topic of conversation.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup> Be sure to chew and swallow your food thoroughly before you start talking, and listen attentively to those around you.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-11.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you don’t know the people sitting next to you, introduce yourself and ask them how they know the host. That should be enough to get a lively conversation going!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Cover your mouth if you need to burp.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cover-your-mouth-if-you-need-to-burp.\">Cover your mouth if you need to burp.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Burping happens, and that’s okay. If you feel a burp coming on, quickly cover your mouth with your napkin and keep your mouth closed so it isn’t loud. When you’re done, just say “excuse me” and keep eating.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/98/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-12.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you get the hiccups and they won’t go away, it’s polite to leave the table until they stop.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: Pick up your utensils if you drop them.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Pick-up-your-utensils-if-you-drop-them.\">Pick up your utensils if you drop them.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Then, ask for a new one. If you can’t reach the utensils you dropped, let the waiter or the host know as you request a new one. The same thing goes for your napkin: if it touches the floor, just ask for a replacement.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6e/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-13.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you drop any food, discreetly pick it up with your napkin. Then, ask your waiter for a new napkin.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=15\" title=\"Edit section: Put your utensils on your plate when you’re done.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Put-your-utensils-on-your-plate-when-you’re-done.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Put-your-utensils-on-your-plate-when-you.E2.80.99re-done.\">Put your utensils on your plate when you’re done.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It will make cleanup a lot easier. Try to place them both in the center of your plate so they don’t fall off. If you’re at a restaurant, it will signal to the waiter that you’re ready for your plate to be taken away.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 14 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-14-Version-2.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-14-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can cross your utensils or just place them side by side.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=16\" title=\"Edit section: Help clear the table at the end of the meal.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Help-clear-the-table-at-the-end-of-the-meal.\">Help clear the table at the end of the meal.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If you’re at a family dinner, pitch in for the cleanup. Help gather plates, napkins, and cups to bring to the kitchen. If you’re really feeling polite, you could even offer to wash the dishes! The host will really appreciate it, and you might just land an invite to the next dinner party.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Have Good Table Manners Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/16/Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-15.jpg/aid54235-v4-728px-Have-Good-Table-Manners-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=17\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=18\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>When in doubt, copy what the host does.</li> \n  <li>If you need to excuse yourself to the restroom, just say, “excuse me, I’ll be right back.” No need to elaborate on where you’re going.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=19\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Become-a-Wine-Connoisseur\" title=\"Become a Wine Connoisseur\">Become a Wine Connoisseur</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Seat-Dinner-Guests\" title=\"Seat Dinner Guests\">Seat Dinner Guests</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Open-a-Bottle-of-Wine\" title=\"Open a Bottle of Wine\">Open a Bottle of Wine</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Eat-at-a-Sit-Down-Restaurant\" title=\"Eat at a Sit Down Restaurant\">Eat at a Sit Down Restaurant</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Use-a-Napkin-with-Proper-Table-Etiquette\" title=\"Use a Napkin with Proper Table Etiquette\">Use a Napkin with Proper Table Etiquette</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=20\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Have-Good-Table-Manners&amp;action=edit&amp;section=21\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.bhg.com/health-family/parenting-skills/responsible-kids/good-table-manners/\">https://www.bhg.com/health-family/parenting-skills/responsible-kids/good-table-manners/</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Have-Good-Table-Manners#_ref-2\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" 90229},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\"><p>This wikiHow teaches you how to see your Facebook friends' upcoming birthdays using an iPhone or iPad. Although birthdays used to appear on the Events calendar, you will now find them on a special page called Birthdays. And if you're worried you'll forget your friends' birthdays, you can customize your Facebook notifications so you'll always be notified of upcoming birthdays.\n</p>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad&#38;action=edit&#38;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad&#38;action=edit&#38;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Viewing Birthdays on Facebook\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Viewing-Birthdays-on-Facebook\">Viewing Birthdays on Facebook</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad. The Facebook icon looks like a white \"f\" in a blue square. You can find it on your Home screen or in your App Library.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Tap the magnifying glass. It's in the upper-right area of the screen. This opens the Search bar.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 2 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Type . After you type the first several letters, you'll see \"Birthdays\" with a green-and-white cake icon appear at the top of the search results.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 3 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Tap  in the search results. This displays current, belated, recent, and upcoming birthdays on the same screen.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 4 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li></ol>\n<h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad&#38;action=edit&#38;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Turning On Birthday Notifications\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Turning-On-Birthday-Notifications\">Turning On Birthday Notifications</span></h3>\n<ol><li>Open the Facebook app on your iPhone or iPad. The Facebook icon looks like a white \"f\" in a blue square. You can find it on your Home screen or in your App Library. If you find yourself forgetting your friends' birthdays, you can customize birthday notifications on Facebook.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 5 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Tap the three-line menu . It's at the bottom-right corner of Facebook.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-6.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Scroll down and tap . Additional options will expand.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-7.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Scroll down and tap . It's in the \"Notifications\" section, which is about halfway down the page between the \"Ads\" and \"Shortcuts\" sections.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-8.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Tap . A list of options for receiving birthday notifications will appear.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-9.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Toggle the \"Allow Notifications on Facebook\" switch to the On position . When the switch is blue, you'll receive notifications in Facebook for upcoming and/or belated birthdays.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-10.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>If this switch is already on (blue), there is no need to make any changes.</li></ul></li>\n<li>Select where you want to receive notifications. In the \"Where you receive these notifications\" section, you can enable Push notifications (the kind that pop up in Facebook your iPhone or iPad), email notifications, and/or SMS text notifications from Facebook.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-11.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div></li>\n<li>Toggle the \"Upcoming Birthdays\" switch to the On position . This option, under the \"Receive notifications for\" header, ensures that you'll be notified of birthdays before they happen.<div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-12.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"See Birthdays on Facebook on iPhone or iPad Step 12.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-12.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-12.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a></div>\n<ul><li>The \"Belated birthdays\" option is turned on by default. If you don't want to be notified of birthdays you've missed, you can tap the switch to turn it off.</li></ul></li></ol>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad&#38;action=edit&#38;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2>\n<ul><li>Another way to open the Birthdays page is to tap the Notifications icon (the bell) at the bottom of the screen and select any of your current or past birthday notifications.</li>\n<li>If a friend hasn't made their birthday public on Facebook, you will not see their birthday on the calendar or be notified when it's approaching.</li>\n<li>To view a specific friend's birthday, open their profile, tap <b>About</b>, select <b>See All About</b> at the bottom, and then find their birthday under \"Basic Info.\" If you don't see it there, they haven't made their birthdate public.</li></ul>\n<h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad&#38;action=edit&#38;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Quick Summary\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Quick-Summary\">Quick Summary</span></h2>\n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Wed, 11 Aug 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"24835e71ffe355caf81f8cde429ae6ac","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn21@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-22-529_7fb38991ab2774c6.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":66805,"destBytes":37884,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c2/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx14/cdn21@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-22-529_7fb38991ab2774c6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-2-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn30@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-29-075_efe187722178c0c5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-3-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn34@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-31-049_6d77e0de64631fba.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-4-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn24@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-29-076_1a1dfe46f073bae7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0a/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-5-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn58@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-30-017_2e298246ba7295c7.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6f/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-6.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn62@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-307_bbf203309250f9da.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/38/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-7.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx16/cdn47@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-194_420df1fbf9f7638e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/5b/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-8.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn36@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-29-213_8294b3131ff808d5.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d3/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-9.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn9@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-30-655_cd4fdbe2bd951249.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/cd/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-10.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn93@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-32-299_bf2f7596597f2a96.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b0/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-11.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn49@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-30-648_f74d37c5ba6d0ed9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b2/See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-12.jpg/aid9653932-v4-728px-See-Birthdays-on-Facebook-on-iPhone-or-iPad-Step-12.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx21/cdn41@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-29-621_3fcf56a82419b36d.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590207},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Cook Kabobs in the Oven","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs\" title=\"Cook Kabobs\">Kabobs</a> are a delicious meal or snack! Eat the kabobs alone or serve them on top of rice, quinoa, or a salad. Prepare and marinate the chicken the day before you plan to cook it. This will help tenderize the meat and add flavor to the kabobs. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Ingredients\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ingredients\">Ingredients</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>of boneless skinless chicken breast</li> \n  <li>2 large yellow onions</li> \n  <li>3 bell peppers</li> \n  <li>of avocado oil or olive oil</li> \n  <li>4 tablespoons of lemon juice</li> \n  <li>1 tablespoon of fresh flat-leaf parsley chopped</li> \n  <li>1 teaspoon of salt</li> \n  <li>½ teaspoon of pepper</li> \n  <li>½ teaspoon of garlic powder</li>\n </ul> \n <p><i>Makes 2 servings</i> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Preparing the Skewers and the Marinade\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Preparing-the-Skewers-and-the-Marinade\">Preparing the Skewers and the Marinade</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Soak the wooden skewers overnight. Place the wooden skewers in a clean bowl that is wider than the length of the skewers. Half fill the bowl with cold tap water and submerge the skewers in the water. This will help stop the skewers from drying out or burning in the oven.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Kabobs in the Oven Step 1 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-1-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you forget to do this the night before, leave them in water for as long as possible, even a few hours will help.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Measure the oil and lemon juice into a bowl. Add of lemon juice and of avocado oil or olive oil into a medium-sized bowl. Use cold-pressed avocado or olive oil if possible, as this type of oil is rich in nutrients.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /></li> \n  <li>Add the dry ingredients and whisk the mixture until it’s combined. Measure of fresh flat-leaf parsley, 1 teaspoon of salt, ½ teaspoon of pepper, and ½ teaspoon of garlic powder into the bowl. Use a fork or a whisk to briskly stir the ingredients together. Continue whisking until the ingredients have all merged together, this will take about 1 minute.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use circular stirring motions to stop the mixture from splashing over the edges of the bowl.</li> \n    <li>If you don’t have flat leaf parsley you can substitute it for a different variety of parsley. If you don’t enjoy the flavor of parsley, try using coriander, basil or rosemary instead.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Marinating the Chicken\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Marinating-the-Chicken\">Marinating the Chicken</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Cut the chicken into cubes. Use a clean, sharp knife to cut the chicken. Place the chicken onto a chopping board and cut the chicken crosswise into wide strips. Turn the board 90 degrees and cut the breasts lengthways, leaving gaps between the cuts. This process creates chicken cubes that are an easy size to push onto the skewers.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Always wash your hands after touching chicken to avoid food poisoning.</li> \n    <li>Make sure that the chicken is fully defrosted before you start preparing it.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Place the chicken cubes and marinade into a ziplock bag. Transfer the chicken cubes into a medium sized ziplock bag. Use one hand to hold the ziplock bag open and the other hand to gently pour the marinade into the bag. Close the ziplock bag and check that no marinade is leaking from the seal.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If the seal on the bag isn’t working, pour the chicken and marinade into a new bag.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Massage the marinade into the chicken with your hands. Place the bag of chicken and marinade onto a hard surface, such as a chopping board. Squish the chicken around in the marinade until you have covered all of the chicken cubes with marinade.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Press down on the chicken cubes as you move them around. This will help the marinade to soak into the chicken.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Refrigerate the chicken cubes for 4-6 hours. Place the ziplock bag of marinated chicken into the fridge. Leave it for 4-6 hours to achieve the optimum flavor.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Kabobs in the Oven Step 7 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7d/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-7-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you are short on time, even 1 hour will help to soften and flavor the meat.</li> \n    <li>Don’t leave the chicken to marinate for more than 24 hours as this increases the risk of food poisoning.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Constructing the Kabobs\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Constructing-the-Kabobs\">Constructing the Kabobs</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Preheat the oven to . Turn your oven to the bake setting and set it to . Place the oven rack in the middle shelf of the oven. This will help the kabobs to cook evenly. Most ovens take at least 10 minutes to heat up.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Kabobs in the Oven Step 8 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-8-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Cut the peppers into strips. Cut the bell peppers in half and pull out the seeds from the middle. Use a sharp knife to make lengthwise cuts that are about apart. Turn the chopping board 90 degrees and cut crossways, leaving gaps between your cuts.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Repeat this process for all 3 peppers.</li> \n    <li>Use different colored peppers to add contrast and color to your kabobs.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Chop 2 large onions into pieces. Cut the onion in half using a sharp knife and peel the skin off the onions. Place the flat side of the onion onto the chopping board. Cut the onion in half lengthways and then crossways, to create quarters that are approximately in size.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Peel apart the layers of the chopped onion so you have thin chunks of onion.</li> \n    <li>Repeat this process for both onions.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Push the chicken and vegetables onto the skewers. Remove the chicken from the fridge. Push a piece of chicken onto the skewer so that it is about from the bottom of the skewer. Place a vegetable onto the skewer and push it down until it is touching the chicken. Keep repeating this process until you have filled the kabobs with chicken and vegetables.<br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Kabobs in the Oven Step 11 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-11-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Leave about at the top of the stick.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>Repeat this process until you have used all the vegetables and chicken.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Place the kabobs on an oven tray that has been lined with aluminum foil. Tear a sheet of aluminum foil that is the width of the oven dish. Line the dish with the foil and place the kabobs on top. Spread the kabobs evenly across the dish.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure that the kabobs aren’t touching each other.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Baking the Kabobs\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Baking-the-Kabobs\">Baking the Kabobs</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Place the kabobs into the oven for 15 minutes. Transfer the tray into the middle shelf of the oven. Leave the tray uncovered as this will allow the vegetables to become crispy. Remove the tray from the oven after 15 minutes.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Kabobs in the Oven Step 13 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-13-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Use oven mitts when touching the hot tray.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Remove the kabobs from the oven and flip the skewers over. Take the oven tray out of the oven and place it onto a heat-proof surface. Use tongs to gently turn over each kabob. Make sure that none of the kabobs are touching each other before placing the tray back into the oven.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Kabobs in the Oven Step 14 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-14-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li> \n  <li>Bake for another 10 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through. Remove the chicken from the oven after 10 minutes. Take a piece of chicken off a kabob and cut it in half. If the inside of the chicken is still pink, leave the kabobs to cook for a further 5-10 minutes.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Serve the kabobs with your favorite sides. Salad, quinoa or rice are all tasty options.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Store the leftover kabobs in the fridge for 3-4 days. Place the leftover kabobs into an airtight container and leave them in the fridge. Eat the kabobs cold or reheat them in the microwave or oven.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-16-Version-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Cook Kabobs in the Oven Step 16 Version 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-16-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-16-Version-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you reheat the kabobs, make sure you heat them until they are hot to touch. This decreases the likelihood of food poisoning.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Things You’ll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You’ll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.E2.80.99ll-Need\">Things You’ll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>12 wooden skewers</li> \n  <li>Tablespoon</li> \n  <li>½ teaspoon</li> \n  <li>Medium-sized bowl</li> \n  <li>Chopping board</li> \n  <li>Sharp knife</li> \n  <li>Oven tray</li> \n  <li>Oven mitt</li> \n  <li>Aluminum foil</li> \n  <li>Ziplock bag</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Substitute chicken for different meats to vary the flavors of the kabobs. Consider using beef, lamb or pork.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol class=\"references\"> \n   <li id=\"_note-1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven#_ref-1\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\"
