+0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-1-Version-3.jpg","linkMd5":"4fdf9ede3da0aea50e11e5860ea020f2","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn18@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-22-524_81abc6560f85cd13.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":410,"sourceBytes":117216,"destBytes":90738,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4d/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-1-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-1-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn18@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-22-524_81abc6560f85cd13.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/7d/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-7-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-7-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn41@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-29-075_98adc7d77c75c593.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-8-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-8-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn94@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-025_6b7a76493fef58cc.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/77/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-11-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-11-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx25/cdn88@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-29-588_43d8b8b0dc2543f6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/80/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-13-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-13-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn61@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-30-115_24e1cd0feff855e0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/22/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-14-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-14-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx/cdn76@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-247_a5ca9b43b52c8c6f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/2d/Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-16-Version-3.jpg/aid10213257-v4-728px-Cook-Kabobs-in-the-Oven-Step-16-Version-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn73@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-32-205_5a13283fea7a9679.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590231},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Stay Relevant on Social Media","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Whether you’re a small business owner, an influencer, or the face of a corporation, social media is a great tool you can use to connect with more people. Since the very nature of social media is constantly changing, it can be hard to keep up with the times. We’ve compiled a list of a few ways you can stay relevant on social media to continue relating to your audience and get new followers. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Connect with your audience.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Connect-with-your-audience.\">Connect with your audience.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Ask questions and reply to comments to see what your followers like. The more you can get feedback from them, the happier they’ll be! Host polls on your Instagram or Twitter, ask questions on your posts or stories, and respond to comments underneath your pictures.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-1.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If your followers don’t like what you’re posting, try to find out why. Not everyone’s going to love your content 100% of the time, but if the majority of your audience isn’t happy, you might need to switch something up.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Vary your content.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Vary-your-content.\">Vary your content.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>People might get tired of posts that all look the same. If you normally post your workout routine, try mixing it up with some nature shots. If you usually post a lot of selfies, try taking some pics of your pet instead. Break up your feed so your followers get excited when you post something new.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-2.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You don’t have to abandon your “brand” completely—you can still keep your posts relevant to your audience.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Post consistently.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Post-consistently.\">Post consistently.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Your followers might forget about you if you take too much time off. While it’s totally fine to take a break from social media (in fact, it’s probably a good idea once in a while), posting content on a regular basis will keep you in the spotlight.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup> It’s up to you how often you post, but once a week is usually a good starting point.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-3.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you do decide to take a break from social media, let your followers know. That way, they’ll expect you to come back and keep an interest in your content.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Pay attention to current trends.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Pay-attention-to-current-trends.\">Pay attention to current trends.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Try to figure out what’s relevant and what’s not. Search through popular hashtags, read pop culture articles, and follow other people on social media.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup> You can really uplift your social media presence if you latch onto current trends.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-4.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Current trends might also mean jumping from one social media platform to another (remember when we all switched from MySpace to Facebook?). Don’t be afraid to make new accounts on different platforms to reach a wider audience.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Post when your audience is online.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Post-when-your-audience-is-online.\">Post when your audience is online.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Take a look at your analytics to see when your followers engage the most. Try to post content when most people are online so they actually see your content. If you have followers all over the world, you may have to pick and choose when to post.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-5.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you have a business account on Instagram, you can look at your analytics to figure out when your followers are online.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Partner with influencers on social media.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Partner-with-influencers-on-social-media.\">Partner with influencers on social media.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Influencers reach a wide audience that you can capitalize on. If you sell a product, consider reaching out to influencers to give them coupon codes in exchange for a review on social media. If you’re an influence yourself, try reaching out to others for collaborations on content.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-6.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try to find influencers with a lot of followers who are relevant online. If they often show up on your Explore Page or in popular hashtags, it’s a safe bet that they’re reaching a pretty wide audience.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Be authentic.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Be-authentic.\">Be authentic.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Followers are more likely to engage if they’re seeing the real you. When you post on social media, try to stay true to yourself and post content that you truly enjoy.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup> If you’re doing it all for the likes or the follows, people might not be as interested in your posts.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-7.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>This is true even if you’re posting on behalf of a brand or a company. If you try too hard or seem inauthentic, your audience won’t trust you as much.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Stay flexible.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Stay-flexible.\">Stay flexible.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If your content isn’t working, be willing to mix it up. If your pics aren’t getting as many likes as they used to, try posting videos instead. If you latched onto a trend that isn’t relevant anymore, toss it aside and go for something new. Social media is constantly changing, and you should too!<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stay Relevant on Social Media Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-8.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, TikTok and Instagram Reels have gained a ton of popularity. If you aren’t used to posting video content, it can be a tough switch—but it might just be worth it.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Stay active on social media by liking, commenting, and sharing other people’s posts.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-1.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"0fee4da70829bb41d739f84d8060a858","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn31@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-26-605_d98dcee26adb7d22.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":73975,"destBytes":33086,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/29/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-1.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn31@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-26-605_d98dcee26adb7d22.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/85/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-2.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn30@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-31-232_e2bff488d190ec36.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f2/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-3.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn46@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-30-976_627a3dd3ca01b173.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/13/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-4.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn83@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-526_8371216d8c8396b9.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/fe/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-5.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn38@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-32-026_cc8b55f69410765e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/f/f0/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-6.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn33@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-31-257_bbef2b4aceab90e6.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/47/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-7.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn86@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-30-458_60f98a82169eec9b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/82/Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-8.jpg/aid12468641-v4-728px-Stay-Relevant-on-Social-Media-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn7@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-29-516_e6d9fdf1265fee87.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590216},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Text messages can be a great way to stay in touch with someone even if they live super far away from you. If you’ve got a good thing going with a girl and you’re messaging each other back and forth, why not give it a shot and ask her out? It may be easier than you realize! To help you do it, we’ve put together a handy list of tips and ideas about what you can say to increase your chances of getting her to say yes. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Start with texts that will make her smile.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Start-with-texts-that-will-make-her-smile.\">Start with texts that will make her smile.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Be playful and keep it lighthearted. Send her something funny or sweet to get the conversation started. Start things off on the right foot by putting her in a good mood so she’ll be much more open to the idea of going out with you.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 1 Version 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-1-Version-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could try, “Hey there pretty lady. How’s your day been?” or “You’ve been on my mind all day so I figured I’d text you. How are you?”</li> \n    <li>You could also try sending her a funny meme and say, “I thought you might like this.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Try asking her for advice to get date ideas.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Try-asking-her-for-advice-to-get-date-ideas.\">Try asking her for advice to get date ideas.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It’s also a great way to set up asking her out. If you aren’t completely sure what she’s into or if you’re looking for date ideas, try asking her for help. Tell her you’re looking for something you think she might be interested in and if she has any suggestions.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-2.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could try, “I know you love sushi, it’s like all you talk about! Do you have a favorite restaurant in your city?”</li> \n    <li>Another option is something like, “Do you know any good wing spots around you? I know you like it spicy!”</li> \n    <li>It doesn’t have to be food-related, though. You could try, “I was thinking about going hiking when I come to town. You’re into the great outdoors, know any good places?”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: See if she’s down for a virtual dinner date.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"See-if-she’s-down-for-a-virtual-dinner-date.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"See-if-she.E2.80.99s-down-for-a-virtual-dinner-date.\">See if she’s down for a virtual dinner date.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Have dinner without leaving your home! Ask her if she’d like to have dinner with you at the same time and you can pretend like you’re at a restaurant together. Use an app like FaceTime, Skype, or Zoom to do a video call while you eat together.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-3.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could try, “Since we’re so far away, why don’t we do a video call at 7 and we can eat dinner together at the same time!”</li> \n    <li>You could even exchange recipes so you’re both cooking and eating the same thing.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Try watching a movie together virtually.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Try-watching-a-movie-together-virtually.\">Try watching a movie together virtually.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Netflix and chill, even from a distance. Offer up the idea of watching a movie together at the same time. If she’s interested, pick out a movie together on a streaming app like Netflix or Hulu. Set a time for you guys to get on a video call together on an app like Facetime or Zoom and start the movie at the same time!<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-4.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There are even apps like Google Watch Party that allow you to watch the same movie or show together while you’re on a video call.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Suggest a coffee date to keep it casual.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Suggest-a-coffee-date-to-keep-it-casual.\">Suggest a coffee date to keep it casual.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>It’s a low-pressure way to ask her out. Who doesn’t like coffee? Plus, if you’ve only been texting her, it could be a great opportunity to meet face to face without the high stakes of a formal date. Try asking her if she can meet you for coffee when you’re in town.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-5.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could try, “Hey! I’ll be visiting my cousin in a few weeks. You wanna grab some coffee?”</li> \n    <li>If she happens to be visiting your area, you could try, “Awesome! Let’s get together and grab a coffee.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Plan an in-person dinner date if you can.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Plan-an-in-person-dinner-date-if-you-can.\">Plan an in-person dinner date if you can.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Pick out a great first-date spot. If you plan to be in her area, or if she’s visiting near where you live, try asking if she’d like to grab dinner with you. Pick out a fun dinner spot with food that you’ll both enjoy and set a date and time to meet up. If she’s into it, she’ll say yes!<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-6.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You could try, “So, there are some really great Mexican restaurants around here. Would you want to come check one out with me when you get to town?”</li> \n    <li>You could also try, “I used to love going to this burger joint when I was a kid. I haven’t been there in ages. Would you want to come with me when I come to visit?”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Visit a museum or an art gallery.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Visit-a-museum-or-an-art-gallery.\">Visit a museum or an art gallery.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Go with a more cultured approach if she’s into it. If she’s a fan of art, paintings, or history, a museum is a great choice. Look for some in her area if you’re visiting near her, or pick out some cool ones around you if she’s coming to your area. Ask her if she’d like to check it out with you.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e3/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-7.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try, “I know you’re into cocktails, and there’s this really cool museum all about their history if you want to come check it out with me.”</li> \n    <li>You could also try, “There’s a great Alexander McQueen exhibit going on at the museum in town. You wanna go with me?”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Ask her if she’d like to join in on your plans.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Ask-her-if-she’d-like-to-join-in-on-your-plans.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Ask-her-if-she.E2.80.99d-like-to-join-in-on-your-plans.\">Ask her if she’d like to join in on your plans.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Try going with the direct approach. Don’t stress about whether or not she’ll say yes. Just calmly ask her if she’d like to come with you if you already have a planned event or party. Keep it super simple so there’s no confusion.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-8.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you could try, “I’m coming to town for a friend of mine’s wedding. Do you want to come as my date?”</li> \n    <li>You could also try, “I’m visiting my parents later this year, would you want to come along with me?”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Work out the details if she says yes.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Work-out-the-details-if-she-says-yes.\">Work out the details if she says yes.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Have fun planning out the date with her. Congratulations! You’ve done it. Talk to her about the logistics of getting together, which may be a little trickier and require more planning since you don’t live near each other. Coordinate travel plans and set a date and time to get together.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-9.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you could try, “Great! I get into town on Sunday the 18th. Wanna get together then?”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Be cool and accept it if she says no.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Be-cool-and-accept-it-if-she-says-no.\">Be cool and accept it if she says no.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>You don’t want to ruin any future chances by getting upset. Maybe she’s not open to the idea of a long-distance relationship, or maybe she’s just not interested right now. Whatever her reasons, it’s important that you accept her answer. Stay calm and tell her it’s no problem. You can still keep texting her, and who knows, maybe one day she’ll be more open to the idea of going out with you.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-10.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try something short and sweet like, “No worries! Just figured I’d ask.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Verify her info if you’ve never met her before.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Verify-her-info-if-you’ve-never-met-her-before.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Verify-her-info-if-you.E2.80.99ve-never-met-her-before.\">Verify her info if you’ve never met her before.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Make sure she’s not pretending to be someone else. “Catfishing” is when someone pretends to be someone they’re not in order to get closer to someone. If she has a social media or dating profile, run her profile picture through a reverse image search on Google to make sure it’s legit. Take a look through their social media to see if it’s real and doesn’t look fishy or like a bot account.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Ask a Girl Out over Text Long Distance Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-11.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Don’t give someone your bank account or financial information if you don’t really know them.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If she’s had a bad day or is super distracted, you may want to wait for another time to ask her out. She might be more open to it.</li>\n </ul> \n <p><br /> </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Thu, 12 Aug 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-1-Version-2.jpg","linkMd5":"6dd116ea9a463b2a3c428dc6b624a496","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn10@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-22-491_42f2bb80b670e637.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":93938,"destBytes":52526,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-1-Version-2.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-1-Version-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx15/cdn10@2020_3/2021/08/15/03-53-22-491_42f2bb80b670e637.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e6/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-2.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn86@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-31-518_b37050cfa761530b.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-3.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx23/cdn86@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-40-147_fdc2c76129276835.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/3e/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-4.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx10/cdn29@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-32-444_9155e0cb23ab9e53.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/9/96/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-5.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn86@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-598_39bb8070bbb48321.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/c/c9/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-6.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn26@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-32-482_a0253786a99515bf.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/e3/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-7.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx3/cdn72@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-373_f3fddbfc0e107f5f.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6c/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-8.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx24/cdn16@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-29-515_59278408382813a0.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0d/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-9.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn34@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-29-878_6180836bb5108583.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/7/76/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-10.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn13@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-30-477_1fdd008ce8ccab6c.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/8d/Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-11.jpg/aid12652537-v4-728px-Ask-a-Girl-Out-over-Text-Long-Distance-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx30/cdn50@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-29-176_5c0a95d2a10c4dfd.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590236},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Read Algebraic Chess Notation","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p> Algebraic chess notation, based on a system introduced by Philipp Stamma,<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup> is a system for recording chess movements. Being more concise and less ambiguous, algebraic chess notation has become the standard method for recording chess moves, replacing the once popular system of descriptive chess notation.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup> </p>\n <p>If you are serious about chess, it is very important to learn how to read and use algebraic chess notation correctly, so you can enjoy the vast amount of chess literature available and study your own games. Many tournaments require you to take notation, and it is for your benefit during post-game analysis so you can improve your game. This article will show you how to read, write, and understand algebraic chess notation. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <ol>\n  <li>Get a chess set and <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Set-up-a-Chessboard\" title=\"Set up a Chessboard\">set it up</a>. Although not absolutely necessary, having a chess set in front of you will help you follow along as you read chess notations.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Algebraic Chess Notation Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-1.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"484\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A digital board analysis board will work as well.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how the squares are named. There are 64 squares on the chessboard (32 white, 32 dark), and each one has a unique name denoted by the algebraic chess notation:<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Algebraic Chess Notation Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-2.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"484\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>The vertical files (columns) are labeled A through H, starting from left to right on White's side;</li> \n    <li>The horizontal ranks (rows) are numbered 1 through 8, starting from bottom to top on White's side.</li> \n    <li>A given square on the chessboard is denoted by the lowercase file (column) letter, followed by the rank (row) number. For example, <b>g5</b> is the square corresponding to the file g and rank 5.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how each piece is denoted. Usually, each chess piece is denoted by the first letter of its name in uppercase, except for the knight (which uses an \"N\") and the pawn (nothing). For figurine algebraic notation, a specific symbol is used for each piece.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup> \n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Algebraic Chess Notation Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-3.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"484\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>King = K or ♔ or ♚</li> \n    <li>Queen = Q or ♕ or ♛</li> \n    <li>Rook = R or ♖ or ♜</li> \n    <li>Bishop = B or ♗ or ♝</li> \n    <li>Knight = N (since K is already taken by the king) or ♘ or ♞</li> \n    <li>Pawn = (no letter) -- pawns are denoted by the absence of a letter or ♙ or ♟</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how to write the notation for conventional moves.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Algebraic Chess Notation Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-4.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"484\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Label the move number first. Each pair of moves is prefaced by a number followed by a period which indicates the ordinal number of the pair of moves - i.e., 1. for the first pair of moves (white, then black0, 2. for the second pair of moves, and so on.</li> \n    <li>Write white's move after the move number and follow it with black's move, one pair of moves per line according to the following conventions: \n     <ul>\n      <li><b>Denoting a move to an open square:</b> Write the capital letter which designates the piece, followed by the coordinate of the destination square. For example, a knight going to the square f3 would be denoted as <b>Nf3</b>; a pawn going to the square e4 would be denoted simply as <b>e4</b>. (Remember that pawns do not get a letter).</li> \n      <li><b>Denoting a capture:</b>. Each capture move is denoted by the letter of the piece, followed by a lowercase <b>x</b>, then the coordinate of the destination square.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup> For example, a bishop capturing a piece at c4 would be denoted as <b>Bxc4</b>. Sometimes, the <b>x</b> will be omitted.</li> \n      <li>When a pawn makes a capture, the file (column) from which the pawn departed is used in place of a piece initial. Thus, a pawn on e4 captures a piece on d5 would be denoted as <b>exd5</b>, or simply <b>ed5</b> as the <b>x</b> is sometimes omitted.</li> \n      <li>En passant moves are denoted by the file (column) of departure of the capturing pawn, followed by the square to which it moves, followed, optionally, by the abbreviation \"e.p.\". Thus, a pawn on e5 capturing <i>en passant</i> a pawn on d5 is denoted as <b>exd6</b> or <b>exd6 e.p.</b>.</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how to write special situations.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Algebraic Chess Notation Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-5.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"484\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If two or more identical pieces can move to the same square, the letter for the piece is followed by: \n     <ul>\n      <li>the file (column) of departure if they differ;</li> \n      <li>the rank (row) of departure if the files are the same but the ranks differ;</li> \n      <li>both the rank and file if neither alone uniquely defines the piece.</li> \n      <li>For example, if two knights on d2 and f2 can both reach e4, the move is denoted as Nde4 or Nfd4, as appropriate. If two knights on d2 and d6 can both reach e4, the move would be denoted as <b>N2d4</b> or <b>N6d4</b>, as appropriate. If three knights on d2, d6, and f2 can all reach e4, with capture, the move would be denoted as <b>Nd2xe4</b>, <b>N6xe4</b>, or <b>Nfxe4</b>, as appropriate.</li>\n     </ul></li> \n    <li>For pawn promotion, the piece to which it is promoted is written after the destination coordinate. For example, a pawn on e7 moving to e8 and promoting to a knight would be denoted as <b>e8N</b>. Sometimes an equal sign (=) is used, as in <b>e8=N</b>, or parentheses are used, as in <b>e8(N)</b>, or a slash (/) is used, as in <b>e8/N</b>. Only the first type is used in FIDE standard.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup></li> \n    <li>For castling, O-O denotes king side castle, while O-O-O denotes queen side castle.</li> \n    <li>A check is denoted by + after the move notation; double check may be denoted by ++ (keep in mind that some use \"++\" to signify checkmate as well and many will simply write double check with a single \"+\".</li> \n    <li>Checkmate is denoted by # after the move notation. Some older chess literature may denote ++ as checkmate.</li> \n    <li>A 1-0 is used at the end of the game to denote a white win, 0-1 to denote a black win, and ½-½ (or 0.5-0.5) to denote a draw. The words <b>\"White Resigns\"</b> or <b>\"Black Resigns\"</b> may be used to denote a resignation.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn the punctuation that is used for commentary on the moves.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Algebraic Chess Notation Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-6.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"484\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Punctuation is commonly used to comment on the effectiveness of moves, usually relative to the skill of the player. It is placed after the move. For example:<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup> \n     <ul>\n      <li>! a good move</li> \n      <li>!! an excellent move</li> \n      <li>? a questionable move</li> \n      <li>?? a blunder</li> \n      <li>!? an interesting move but unclear</li> \n      <li>?! a dubious move but worth considering</li>\n     </ul></li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Learn how to put it all together. List of moves are denoted as numbered pairs by White followed by Black.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup> For example, <b>1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Nc6 3. Bc4 Bc5</b>.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Read Algebraic Chess Notation Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-7.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"484\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Moves may be interrupted by comments. When the record resumes with a Black move, an ellipsis (…) takes the place of the White move. For example: <b>1. e4 e5 2. Nf3 Black now defends his pawn. 2...Nc6.</b></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Video\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Video\">Video</span></h2> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>It is important to set up the chess board so that a1 is a black space occupied by the white (king) rook, so white is reading the files (columns) from a-h while h8 is occupied by black's (queen) rook.</li> \n  <li>Practice reading and using algebraic notation and you will get it down very quickly.</li> \n  <li>Always when writing a chess notation put the letters first and then the numbers.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Things You'll Need\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Things-You'll-Need\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Things-You.27ll-Need\">Things You'll Need</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Chess set (optional)</li> \n  <li>Paper or software for practice</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Related wikiHows\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Related-wikiHows\">Related wikiHows</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Become-a-Better-Chess-Player\" title=\"Become a Better Chess Player\">Become a Better Chess Player</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Play-Chess\" title=\"Play Chess\">Play Chess</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Play-Solo-Chess\" title=\"Play Solo Chess\">Play Solo Chess</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Open-in-Chess\" title=\"Open in Chess\">Open in Chess</a></li> \n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Castle-in-Chess\" title=\"Castle in Chess\">Castle in Chess</a></li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\"
