</div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Fri, 13 Aug 2021 08:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-1.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"dad5724b9f02dcc1ba2ec0ae883723e6","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn27@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-14-894_7557ac3a8f12e348.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":484,"sourceBytes":76821,"destBytes":55214,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/ba/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-1.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx32/cdn27@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-14-894_7557ac3a8f12e348.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/0c/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-2.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx19/cdn65@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-32-214_fff6863b83277306.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-3.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx29/cdn98@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-30-428_9f182e851b1f2132.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/36/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-4.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx5oss/cdn91@2020_2/2021/08/15/03-53-29-501_1fc4179966fa0f65.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/e/eb/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-5.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn9@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-171_4ed787c28cdefe9a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/8/89/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-6.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx8/cdn38@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-30-031_349fe039f31e6905.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/09/Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-7.jpg/aid715869-v4-728px-Read-Algebraic-Chess-Notation-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx31/cdn26@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-659_d20bb23569894a18.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590243},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>If you want to stand up for yourself but always feel the tears coming, you’re not alone. It can be really difficult and frustrating when crying becomes a major obstacle to expressing yourself⁠—especially when you know that what you have to say is valid and important. There might be many reasons why you tend to cry⁠, like emotional distress or lack of self confidence⁠, but you shouldn't feel like there’s no way to stand up for yourself without crying, or that you’re stuck in the same situation every time: we hope that with the help of these strategies, you’ll be able to prioritize and stand up for yourself, and gain the respect that you deserve. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Take deep breaths.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Take-deep-breaths.\">Take deep breaths.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Taking deep breaths activates a natural relaxation response. If you feel like you’re on the verge of crying, you’re likely feeling stressed and overwhelmed⁠. Taking a deep breath is a quick but effective way to reduce tension and stress. By taking deep breaths, you’re sending a message to your brain to calm down⁠⁠—your heart rate, blood pressure, and breathing will all decrease. This may help you stand up for yourself without crying because you’ll feel more relaxed and grounded.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-1.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 1.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-1.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-1.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can even practice special breathing exercises to help relax. For example, you can try belly breathing: sit or lie flat, put one hand on your belly, and take a deep breath in through your nose, letting your belly push your hand out. Then breathe out through pursed lips and use your hand to push the air out of your belly. Repeat 3-10 times, taking your time with each breath.</li> \n    <li>If you can get a few minutes by yourself, close your eyes while you're taking deep breaths, and imagine something that makes you feel peaceful and happy.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Use “I” statements to reduce defensiveness.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Use-“I”-statements-to-reduce-defensiveness.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Use-.E2.80.9CI.E2.80.9D-statements-to-reduce-defensiveness.\">Use “I” statements to reduce defensiveness.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Using “I” language will make the encounter less hostile. By using “I” statements, you can help draw the conversation away from an atmosphere that becomes too negative and accusatory. When you focus on communicating your perspective without trying to attack the other person, you can help defuse the situation and tone down intense emotions that might be causing you to cry.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-2.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 2.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-2.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-2.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, rather than saying “You really hurt me when you said that,” try saying instead, “I was hurt by what you said.”</li> \n    <li>Or, if you are disagreeing with the other person, you can say something like “I understand why you feel that way and I hear you, but this is how I feel.”</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Speak firmly and deliberately.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Speak-firmly-and-deliberately.\">Speak firmly and deliberately.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Another way to prevent yourself from crying is to be deliberate. Rather than going on and on, say what you want to and then stop and wait for the other person to respond. Even if you have a lot you want to say, you’ll be able to get to it in in time⁠—but if you let yourself get caught up in your frustration and sadness all at once, you may be more likely escalate your emotions and begin crying.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-3.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 3.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-3.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-3.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Try not to raise your voice or show that you’re upset. By keeping cool and being as fact-based as possible, you’ll make it easier for yourself to get your points across.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Pretend you’re acting and everyone else is an actor too.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Pretend-you’re-acting-and-everyone-else-is-an-actor-too.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Pretend-you.E2.80.99re-acting-and-everyone-else-is-an-actor-too.\">Pretend you’re acting and everyone else is an actor too.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Thinking of the encounter as part of a script may help you distance yourself emotionally. Then, it won’t feel so much like real life or a really personal encounter⁠—but rather something you can get through with a clear head because it’s constructed and not real. Instead of being caught up in the moment, pretend that you and everyone around you are just acting out a scene in a movie or play. This might help you get through what you need to say without crying.\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-4.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 4.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-4.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-4.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, imagine that you’re standing on a stage in a theater. You might be the main character, and the person you’re standing up to is the antagonist. As you speak, try your best to believe that everything you say, and that they say in response, is part of a written script or predetermined plot.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Use quick tricks to ward off the tears.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Use-quick-tricks-to-ward-off-the-tears.\">Use quick tricks to ward off the tears.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If the encounter is unexpected or you’re caught off guard, you can try some tricks. Some of these strategies are more physical, while others are more mental. They can help provide you with an emotional cooldown by briefly distracting you from the situation. The next time you feel like you’re going to cry when you’re standing up for yourself, try one of these tricks:<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-5.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 5.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-5.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-5.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Push your tongue against the roof of your mouth.</li> \n    <li>Pinch the skin between your thumb and pointer finger.</li> \n    <li>Try to think of words that rhyme.</li> \n    <li>Count backward from 100 in 7s.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=7\" title=\"Edit section: Stand up tall.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Stand-up-tall.\">Stand up tall.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Having better body posture can boost your confidence. You may find yourself crying because you don’t have confidence in yourself, but research has found that your body posture can actually make you think more positive thoughts about yourself.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup> Try to stand straight, plant your feet wide, and keep your head up⁠—you may find that you feel better about your worth and what you have to say.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-6.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 6.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-6.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-6.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You can train yourself to be aware of your body posture at any time (not just during confrontations), which is a great confidence boost in general.⁠ Do this by checking in on your posture throughout the day: correct your posture if you find yourself slumping at any time, and it will become more natural and effortless over time!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=8\" title=\"Edit section: Postpone the discussion if you need time to calm down.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Postpone-the-discussion-if-you-need-time-to-calm-down.\">Postpone the discussion if you need time to calm down.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If the situation allows, try scheduling a future time for the encounter. This way, rather than feeling rushed or overwhelmed about the current situation, you’ll have time to calm down and think about what you’re going to say.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-7.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you are dealing with a sibling who always picks on you, tell them that you’d like to speak with them the next week about it, rather than lashing out in the moment.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=9\" title=\"Edit section: Rehearse what you’re going to say.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span id=\"Rehearse-what-you’re-going-to-say.\"></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Rehearse-what-you.E2.80.99re-going-to-say.\">Rehearse what you’re going to say.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>If possible, plan out how you’re going to stand up for yourself. You’ll be less likely to stumble, get tongue twisted, or spiral into emotional distress. By practicing as much as possible, not only can you increase your confidence and decrease your nerves⁠, you’ll also be better at keeping the conversation on track and as objective as possible, rather than ⁠⁠getting caught up in the emotional intensity of the moment.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-8.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 8.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-8.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-8.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>There are many different ways you can practice staying cool during the later encounter. For example, you can practice with yourself in the mirror, or close your eyes and simply run through the scenario in your head, or even role play with a friend or family member!</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=10\" title=\"Edit section: Cry before the encounter.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Cry-before-the-encounter.\">Cry before the encounter.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Getting the emotions out first can help you avoid crying later. If you know that the encounter is coming up in the future rather than happening in the immediate moment, you can try processing the emotions beforehand by letting yourself cry. Once you’ve already dealt with the emotions, you might be more likely to stay calm later.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-9.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 9.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-9.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-9.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=11\" title=\"Edit section: Acknowledge your fear or anxiety.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Acknowledge-your-fear-or-anxiety.\">Acknowledge your fear or anxiety.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>One reason you may be crying is because you feel overwhelmed by anxiety. You might be anticipating and dreading that it’s going to happen. It’s hard to get away from that, even if you want to stand up for yourself⁠—but battling against it might be making it worse. Experiencing anxiety is totally normal, so try and take a moment to accept the anxiety first before speaking, which might help lessen rather than make it worse.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-10.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, step away from the other person or situation for a moment (if possible) and take a second to collect yourself. Recognize that you are anxious about dealing with this, but that your anxiety is normal and temporary.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=12\" title=\"Edit section: Think positive thoughts to change your mindset.\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Think-positive-thoughts-to-change-your-mindset.\">Think positive thoughts to change your mindset.</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Once you’ve acknowledged your anxious thoughts, try to actively change them. Rather than letting the feeling of uncontrollability overwhelm you, help yourself out by turning your thoughts to positivity and optimism. This will help you go into the encounter with a calmer, less agitated mindset⁠—and you’ll feel more comfortable standing up for yourself as a result.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-11.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Stand Up for Yourself Without Crying Step 11.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-11.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-11.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"546\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For example, if you’re not sure how you’re going to get through the confrontation, tell yourself, “I’m going to go out there and try my best. It might seem impossible right now, but it’s a success even if I make a little bit of progress.”</li> \n    <li>Imagine how proud you'll be after you stand up for yourself. Remember, you're worthy of your own protection, so don't be afraid to stand up for yourself.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup></li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=13\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>It’s okay if you aren’t successful on your first or even first couple of tries. It’s important to recognize that not only is crying a common and understandable reaction to emotional distress, but that you can still make a stand and get your point across even if you are crying. You’ll get better with time and practice⁠⁠—so be easy on yourself during the journey!</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying&amp;action=edit&amp;section=14\" title=\"Edit section: References\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"References\">References</span></h2>\n <div class=\"mw-references-wrap mw-references-columns\">\n  <ol </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_ref-9\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" id=\"_note-10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_ref-10\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/14/well/mind/how-to-stop-yourself-from-crying.html\">https://www.nytimes.com/2018/10/14/well/mind/how-to-stop-yourself-from-crying.html</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_ref-11\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://psychcentral.com/blog/overwhelmed-these-6-strategies-may-help#1\">https://psychcentral.com/blog/overwhelmed-these-6-strategies-may-help#1</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_ref-12\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\"><a target=\"_blank\" rel=\"nofollow noreferrer noopener\" class=\"external free\" href=\"https://hbr.org/2017/05/how-to-have-difficult-conversations-when-you-dont-like-conflict\">https://hbr.org/2017/05/how-to-have-difficult-conversations-when-you-dont-like-conflict</a></span> </li> \n   <li id=\"_note-13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying#_ref-13\">↑</a> <span class=\"reference-text\">[v161308_b01]. 19 March 2020.</span> </li> \n  </ol>\n </div> \n</div>","descriptionType":"html","publishedDate":"Tue, 10 Aug 2021 16:00:00 +0000","feedId":44,"bgimg":"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-1.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-1.jpg","linkMd5":"ddc4c420ff926917d21c0bc3e2e6aa0d","bgimgJsdelivr":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn14@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-10-552_a87718398542de57.webp","destWidth":728,"destHeight":546,"sourceBytes":35377,"destBytes":17480,"author":"","articleImgCdnMap":{"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/55/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-1.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-1.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx18/cdn14@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-10-552_a87718398542de57.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a0/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-2.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-2.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx7/cdn33@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-32-077_065c01159ebb04f1.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b4/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-3.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-3.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx6/cdn38@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-32-403_ca3f112b4e84111a.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/d/d8/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-4.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-4.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx2/cdn39@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-28-948_495f1d524286b56e.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b3/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-5.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-5.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx11/cdn2@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-31-433_3b82b08d56969f20.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/3/31/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-6.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-6.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx1/cdn29@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-40-246_89466e3c957e8acb.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/b/b7/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-7.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-7.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn46@2020_5/2021/08/15/03-53-30-297_44fdaa95261dce03.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/27/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-8.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-8.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx27/cdn14@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-29-927_77ce3664be3f0636.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/65/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-9.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-9.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx4/cdn85@2020_4/2021/08/15/03-53-31-852_8b15240d19391543.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/4b/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-10.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-10.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx12/cdn55@2020_1/2021/08/15/03-53-28-949_4eea55198871d7e3.webp","https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/0/08/Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-11.jpg/aid12664932-v4-728px-Stand-Up-for-Yourself-Without-Crying-Step-11.jpg":"https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/gh/myreaderx22/cdn20@2020_6/2021/08/15/03-53-29-457_7449d4ba9d9c8f40.webp"},"publishedOrCreatedDate":1628999590237},{"createdTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","updatedTime":"2021-08-15 11:53:10","title":"How to Put a Quilt on a Bed","link":"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed","description":"<div class=\"mw-parser-output\">\n <p>Quilts are a great way to add some color and texture to your bedroom decor. Putting it on the bed is pretty straightforward, but if you want it to look extra tidy, you can tuck it into the sides and bottom. Doing a hospital tuck at the bottom corners will make your bedding look straight out of a magazine! A decorative quilt can also act as an accessory, giving your bedroom a pop of color and a cozy feel. </p> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed&amp;action=edit&amp;section=1\" title=\"Edit section: Steps\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Steps\">Steps</span></h2> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed&amp;action=edit&amp;section=2\" title=\"Edit section: Making Your Bed Neatly\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Making-Your-Bed-Neatly\">Making Your Bed Neatly</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Stretch the fitted sheet over the 4 corners of your mattress. If your bed is up against a wall or side table, start at that corner first because the last corner is always the hardest to get on. Make sure it fits snug so it’s nice and smooth on top.<sup id=\"_ref-1\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 1\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-1\">[1]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If your fitted sheet has any wrinkles or excess fabric, go down a size so you'll get the smoothest fit.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Place the flat sheet onto your bed and tuck in the excess. Spread the top sheet flat over the bed with the decorative side facing down so the top design will show once you’ve folded it back over the quilt. Arrange it so that the sheet reaches the top edge of the mattress where your head lies. Make sure it's centered so you can tuck it into the sides evenly.<sup id=\"_ref-2\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 2\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-2\">[2]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you're not sure which side of the flat sheet is the decorative side, look at the stitching along the sides. The side with the smoothest edges that doesn’t show where the sheet was folded over and sewn is the decorative side.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Spread the quilt on top of the top sheet with the decorative side facing up. Look at both sides of the quilt to see which one is more vibrantly colored—that’s the side that should be facing up.<sup id=\"_ref-3\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 3\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-3\">[3]</a></sup> Take a walk around the bed to make sure it's centered and that it drapes evenly along the sides and foot of the bed.<sup id=\"_ref-4\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 4\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-4\">[4]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure the quilt is large enough so that it covers the mattress. If not, you’ll need a larger quilt.</li> \n    <li>If your quilt is a little too small, you can still use it as an accessory on top of your bed.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fold the top sheet back over the quilt to make a horizontal band. Move to one corner at the head of the bed and grab the top sheet. Fold it back towards the foot of the bed so that it envelops the quilt.<sup id=\"_ref-5\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 5\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-5\">[5]</a></sup> Pull it back enough so the folded band is at least wide.<sup id=\"_ref-6\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 6\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-6\">[6]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Do this on the other side of the bed as well.</li> \n    <li>Make sure to pull it back enough so that your pillows don’t cover the decorative fold. You may need to pull it back even further if you plan to add a lot of decorative pillows on top.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Smooth out the folded section of the sheet with your hands. Lean over the bed to straighten out any creases or bunching you see in the fold. Use your palms to smooth it down from the center of the fold and outward.<sup id=\"_ref-7\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 7\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-7\">[7]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Do this on both sides until it's nice and straight.</li> \n    <li>You should be able to see the decorative part of your top sheet now.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Tuck the overhang of the quilt and top sheets into the sides of the mattress. Move to one side of the bed and tuck the extra fabric under the mattress. Flatten your hands and tuck with the outer sides to make it easier. Do this all around the bed so it's nice and smooth.<sup id=\"_ref-8\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 8\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-8\">[8]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you want a more tidy look, go for a hospital tuck at the bottom corners.</li> \n    <li>You can leave the excess hanging out for a more relaxed, cozy style. That way, it’ll be easier to hop straight under the covers when you're ready to snooze!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Add your pillows and any decorative touches you like. Place the pillows you sleep on at the head of the bed, propping them up so that you can still see the decorative fold. Put any decorative pillows or throw pillows on top or in front of those.<sup id=\"_ref-9\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 9\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-9\">[9]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-7.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Put a Quilt on a Bed Step 7.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/4/41/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-7.jpg/aid11889737-v4-728px-Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-7.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure the openings of the pillowcases face toward the center of the mattress so you can’t see extra fabric hanging out from the sides.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed&amp;action=edit&amp;section=3\" title=\"Edit section: Doing a Hospital Tuck\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Doing-a-Hospital-Tuck\">Doing a Hospital Tuck</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Tuck the quilt under the mattress along the foot of the bed, not the sides. Make sure the quilt is centered so it drapes evenly down the sides and foot of the bed. Flatten your hands to tuck the quilt into the gap between the mattress and the base or box frame.<sup id=\"_ref-10\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 10\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-10\">[10]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If you have a thick bed frame at the foot of your bed, you’ll need to lift the mattress up a few inches so that you can properly tuck the quilt in.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Lift the corner of the quilt at one of the bottom corners of the bed upward. Grab the edge of the quilt near the corner of the bed at the longest point and fold it upward. Hold it in place with your hand and smooth out the outer fold so it’s straight.<sup id=\"_ref-11\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 11\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-11\">[11]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>You should now have a triangle-shaped fold on top of the bed.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Stuff any excess fabric hanging down as you hold up the corner. With 1 hand still holding the quilt on top of the bed, use your other hand to tuck in any part of the quilt that's dangling down past the mattress. This will make the fold at the bottom corners look nice and crisp.<sup id=\"_ref-12\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 12\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-12\">[12]</a></sup><br /><br />\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-10.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Put a Quilt on a Bed Step 10.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/6/6a/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-10.jpg/aid11889737-v4-728px-Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-10.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"410\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>If your quilt is a little small, you may not have any excess fabric dangling down. That’s perfectly okay and your hospital tuck will look just as neat!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Flip the triangular fold downward and tuck it in. Lift the edge of the quilt that you just folded upward onto the bed and bring it straight down. Straighten it with your hands so that there's a nice vertical fold right at the corner of the mattress. Tuck in the extra fabric until it’s smooth and tidy.<sup id=\"_ref-13\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 13\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-13\">[13]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Repeat this for the other bottom corner of the bed.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Move along each side of the bed and tuck the excess quilt under the mattress. Once you have the corners done, move from the foot to the head of the bed and tuck in any sections of the quilt that are hanging down. If your quilt is thick, you may need to lift the mattress up a few inches around the edge to stuff it in.<sup id=\"_ref-14\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 14\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-14\">[14]</a></sup><br /><br /> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Keep in mind that the farther and tighter you tuck the quilt in, the more you’ll have to wiggle around in the bed to loosen it up.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h3><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed&amp;action=edit&amp;section=4\" title=\"Edit section: Styling Your Bed with a Quilt\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Styling-Your-Bed-with-a-Quilt\">Styling Your Bed with a Quilt</span></h3> \n <ol>\n  <li>Drape a folded quilt horizontally across the foot of the bed. Fold the sheet in half or thirds and lay it horizontally across the foot of the bed, aligning the edge of the quilt with the edge of the mattress.<sup id=\"_ref-15\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 15\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-15\">[15]</a></sup> The half-fold is easy to do if both sides of your quilt are meant to show—just make the bed as usual and fold it straight down.<sup id=\"_ref-16\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 16\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-16\">[16]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-13.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Put a Quilt on a Bed Step 13.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/2/23/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-13.jpg/aid11889737-v4-728px-Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-13.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure the color of the quilt matches the color of at least 1 or 2 of the throw pillows so it looks put together.</li> \n    <li>Lay a bed runner on top of the folded quilt for a touch of luxury.</li> \n    <li>Feel free to drape 2 different quilts across the bed to add a cozy vibe—just make sure the colors and patterns don’t clash.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Fold the quilt into thirds and lay it diagonally across the foot of the bed. Lay the quilt out onto a large folding area with the decorative side facing down. Grab the 2 bottom corners with your hands and fold them a third of the way up. Grab the top corners and fold them to the bottom edge created by your last fold. Carefully pick it up, flip it over, and drape it at a 45-degree angle from your headboard.<sup id=\"_ref-17\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 17\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-17\">[17]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-14.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Put a Quilt on a Bed Step 14.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/a/a3/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-14.jpg/aid11889737-v4-728px-Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-14.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>A 45-degree angle will make sure the quilt stays on the bed if someone were to sit on it and shuffle around a bit. However, feel free to experiment with different angles according to your taste!</li> \n    <li>For a playful, layered look, drape a quilt onto the bed first and place the folded one on top at an angle. Just choose patterns and color schemes that look well together (e.g., 2 pastel colored quilts or 1 patterned and 1 solid-colored quilt).</li> \n    <li>For an ultra-relaxed vibe, skip the folding part and drape the quilt lengthwise at an angle.</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Layer multiple colors of quilts for a cozy, modern look. Choose a colorful patterned quilt and a monochromatic quilt. Spread 1 onto the bed like a bedspread and drape the other across the foot of the bed.<sup id=\"_ref-18\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 18\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-18\">[18]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-15.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Put a Quilt on a Bed Step 15.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/1/15/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-15.jpg/aid11889737-v4-728px-Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-15.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>For instance, you might pair a blue and green paisley quilt with a solid royal-blue quilt.</li> \n    <li>For a more adventurous look, spread a checkered quilt onto the bed and place a folded striped or chevron-patterned quilt at the foot of the bed.</li> \n    <li>This is a great way to spruce up a monochromatic room and make that comfy bed look extra inviting!</li>\n   </ul></li> \n  <li>Put a fluffy comforter over a patterned quilt to keep you warm in the winter. Spread the quilt out onto the bed as you usually would and then top it with a monochromatic comforter. Fold the comforter back so it only covers the bottom third of the bed. The quilt will peek out from under the comforter, giving your bedroom a pop of color and a plush, cozy look.<sup id=\"_ref-19\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 19\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-19\">[19]</a></sup>\n   <div class=\"mwimg  largeimage  floatcenter \" style=\"max-width:728px\">\n    <a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Image:Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-16.jpg\" class=\"image\"><img alt=\"Put a Quilt on a Bed Step 16.jpg\" src=\"https://www.wikihow.com/images/thumb/5/58/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-16.jpg/aid11889737-v4-728px-Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed-Step-16.jpg\" decoding=\"async\" width=\"728\" height=\"485\" class=\"whcdn\" /></a>\n   </div> \n   <ul>\n    <li>Make sure one of the accent colors on the quilt closely matches the color of the comforter.</li> \n    <li>If your comforter is white, choose a quilt with several different colors on it to really make it pop!</li> \n    <li>For summertime, simply fold the comforter all the way down to the foot of the bed so you don’t get too hot.</li>\n   </ul></li>\n </ol> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed&amp;action=edit&amp;section=5\" title=\"Edit section: Tips\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Tips\">Tips</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>Wash your quilt every 1 or 2 weeks in the washing machine with cold water and a gentle detergent. Check to care instructions to see if you can put it in the tumble dryer or if it needs to be air-dried.<sup id=\"_ref-20\" class=\"reference\" aria-label=\"Link to Reference 20\"><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed#_note-20\">[20]</a></sup></li> \n  <li>Use a lint roller to remove pet hair from the quilt at least once a week.</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">[</span><a target=\"_blank\" href=\"https://www.wikihow.com/index.php?title=Put-a-Quilt-on-a-Bed&amp;action=edit&amp;section=6\" title=\"Edit section: Warnings\">Edit</a><span class=\"mw-editsection-bracket\">]</span></span><span class=\"mw-headline\" id=\"Warnings\">Warnings</span></h2> \n <ul>\n  <li>If your bed frame has sharp metal edges, be careful tucking the sheets and quilt in—those corners can cut you if you slide your hand along them just right!</li>\n </ul> \n <h2><span class=\"mw-editsection\"><span
